0.title: Online forum, man booked over posts against HC judge in Bengaluru
0.article_body: The Bengaluru Police registered a case against an online forum Mangalore Muslims and Ateeq Shariff for allegedly posting against a High Court judge who is hearing the hijab case. The Facebook posts were derogatory and cast aspersions on the independence of the judge, the police said. Earlier, Kannada actor Chetan Kumar Ahimsa was arrested for posting against the same judge.

1.title: 80-year-old man lights his own pyre, dies in Nagpur
1.article_body: An 80-year-old man reportedly killed himself by lighting his own pyre in Nagpur. According to family of the deceased, identified as Atmaram Motiram Thawkar, he had a trachea surgery in 2006 from which he never fully recovered. Based on initial probe, police said Thawkar performed puja at a village temple and then built a pyre in a field using firewood.

2.title: Police scale wall to rescue woman, kids locked by her husband in Gujarat
2.article_body: Gujarat Police scaled walls of house to rescue woman and her children who had been locked by woman's husband. The husband reportedly locked them up after woman insisted on attending the last rites of her grandfather. Reports said husband also threatened to attack them with sharp objects. Woman asked for help from balcony. Police then reached woman's room through balcony.

3.title: I lost 7-kg weight during South Africa tour due to infection: Shreyas Iyer
3.article_body: Batter Shreyas Iyer has revealed that he lost 7-kg weight during India's tour of South Africa in December-January. "I had a very bad stomach infection at the start of the year when we were in South Africa.  Basically, whatever I was eating, it was coming out. It was one of the worst phases of my life," Iyer said.

4.title: Ex-BJP MP alleges 4 people known to him kidnapped from outside Delhi home
4.article_body: Senior BJP leader AP Jithender Reddy alleged four of his acquaintances, including a personal driver, were abducted from outside his Delhi residence on Monday. Reddy, a former MP from Mahbubnagar, was in Hyderabad at the time of the alleged incident. In a video shared by Reddy, five-seven men can purportedly be seen forcing the men to get inside a car.

5.title: We will seize Russian billionaires' yachts, luxury apartments, private jets: Biden
5.article_body: During the State of the Union speech on Tuesday, US President Joe Biden said that the US along with European allies will seize Russian billionaires' yachts, their luxury apartments and their private jets. "The United States...is assembling a dedicated task force to go after the crimes of the Russian oligarchs," he further said.

6.title: US and allies making Putin's $630 billion war funds 'worthless': Joe Biden
6.article_body: US President Joe Biden in his State of the Union address said that US and its allies are making "Putin's $630 billion war fund worthless" by preventing Russia's central bank from defending the Russian ruble. "We're choking off Russia's access to technology that will sap its economic strength and weaken its military for years to come," he added.

7.title: Putin thought he could roll into Ukraine, but he badly miscalculated: Biden
7.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Tuesday night said that Russian President Vladimir Putin "badly miscalculated" with his invasion of Ukraine. "He thought he could roll into Ukraine and the world would roll over. Instead he met a wall of strength he never anticipated or imagined. He met the Ukrainian people," Biden said of Putin.

8.title: Russia carries out nuclear submarine drills in Barents Sea
8.article_body: Russia carried out nuclear submarine drills at Barents Sea, days after President Vladimir Putin ordered his country's nuclear forces to be put on high alert amid invasion of Ukraine. Russia's Northern Fleet said in a statement that its nuclear submarines were involved in exercises designed to "train manoeuvring in stormy conditions". The Russia-Ukraine war entered its seventh day today.

9.title: Karnataka reports 202 new COVID-19 cases; 150 in Bengaluru alone
9.article_body: Karnataka reported 202 new coronavirus cases on Tuesday, according to data provided by the state health department. Of the new cases, 150 were reported from the state capital, Bengaluru, alone. The state also reported seven more coronavirus-related deaths, out of which three were reported from Bengaluru. The total number of active coronavirus cases in the city now stands at 3,003.

10.title: 7 Pimpri-Chinchwad police recruitment exam candidates booked for cheating
10.article_body: The Pimpri-Chinchwad police has booked seven candidates who appeared for 2019 Pimpri-Chinchwad police recruitment examination. They were booked after their documents were found to be fake after they were sent for verification to a scrutiny committee. The police have not arrested anyone in the case yet. Police said the cheating happened between November 18, 2021 and January 5, 2022.

11.title: US closes airspace to all Russian aircraft, Biden says 'Putin has no idea what's coming'
11.article_body: US President Joe Biden has announced that the country is closing its airspace to all Russian aircraft. "It will further isolate Russia and add additional squeeze on their economy...Vladimir Putin has no idea what's coming," Biden said. Biden added that the US would join its allies in coming after Russia's oligarchs and seizing their yachts, luxury apartments and private jets.

12.title: Big B cut his fee, said 'spend it on film instead of me': 'Jhund' producer
12.article_body: Producer of the film 'Jhund', Sandeep Singh, said that the film had a "modest budget" and that they were figuring out how to bring actor Amitabh Bachchan on board. "Mr Bachchan loved the script...he stunned us by cutting down on his fee...He said, 'Instead of spending on me, let's spend on the film'...His staff too slashed their fees," Sandeep said.

13.title: Russian crimes are mounting by hour in Ukraine: US Secy of State
13.article_body: Russian "crimes" in Ukraine are mounting by the hour, US Secretary of State Antony Blinken told the UN Human Rights Council on Tuesday. "Russian strikes are hitting schools, hospitals, and residential buildings," he said. Russia has faced criticism from the West over its invasion of Ukraine, which has sparked a refugee crisis.

14.title: Dismantling of 800-bed COVID hospital in Pune's Shivajinagar begins
14.article_body: The dismantling of the jumbo COVID-19 hospital at the College of Engineering Pune (COEP) ground in Shivajinagar has begun. The 800-bed hospital treated at least 3,000 patients in two years of its service. The contract of the hospital, which was set up at the initial cost of ₹75 crore, will end on March 28.

15.title: 2 men sexually assault 16-yr-old male domestic help in Gurugram
15.article_body: Two men have been booked by police for allegedly sexually assaulting a 16-year-old boy who worked as domestic help in Haryana's Gurugram. Investigation into the incident, which reportedly took place in June 2020, revealed that the boy's employer and one of his friends sexually assaulted him. Police said that the two accused went into hiding after committing the offence.

16.title: Man held for setting 29-yr-old's body on fire in Mumbai's Antop Hill
16.article_body: Police have arrested a man for allegedly killing a 29-year-old man and setting his body on fire to destroy evidence in Mumbai's Antop Hill area. The arrest was made after police found a partially charred dead body in the area. Police said the accused had placed a mosquito coil near the body to make it look like an "accidental death".

17.title: IAF aircraft on standby for evacuation of Indians from Ukraine
17.article_body: The Indian Air Force has put its aircraft on standby for 'Operation Ganga' under which Indian nationals will be evacuated from the war-hit Ukraine, officials said. Several heavy-lift planes including the C-17 Globemaster are being put on standby for the evacuation efforts, they added. Prime Minister Narendra Modi has reportedly asked the IAF to join the evacuation efforts.

18.title: Maniesh Paul buys Mercedes worth over ₹1 crore, pics surface
18.article_body: Actor and TV host Maniesh Paul has bought a Mercedes GLS 400 worth over ₹1 crore. Some pictures and videos showed the 40-year-old and his wife and children stepping out of the recently-purchased car in Mumbai. Pictures of the actor purchasing the car have also been widely shared online.

19.title: Fans react to BCCI allowing 50% crowd for Kohli's 100th Test
19.article_body: After BCCI allowed 50% crowd in the stadium for Virat Kohli's 100th Test match in Mohali, a fan wrote on Twitter, "Viratians rule everywhere. We've won in the end." Another fan tweeted, "So happy to hear." Earlier, it was decided that the match will be held behind closed doors, however, the BCCI changed its decision after receiving widespread criticism.

20.title: Special court allows CBI to question Anil Deshmukh inside the jail
20.article_body: A special Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) court granted permission to the CBI to question Maharashtra’s former Home Minister Anil Deshmukh in the corruption case at the Arthur Road Jail in Mumbai. The court allowed CBI to carry electronic devices for recording Deshmukh's statement. Notably, Deshmukh is accused of corruption by former Mumbai Police Commissioner Param Bir Singh.

21.title: Always wanted to play Test series in Pakistan: Steve Smith
21.article_body: Australia Test vice-captain Steve Smith said he always wanted to play a Test series in Pakistan ahead of Australia's historic tour of the country after 24 years. "Because it's a challenge...finally we are getting that chance now," he added. The 32-year-old further said many Australians have come to Pakistan for first time and they're looking forward to some challenging cricket.

22.title: BJP workers attacked my convoy with sticks, stones: Ex-UP Minister
22.article_body: Former Uttar Pradesh Minister Swami Prasad Maurya, who is fighting the state assembly elections from the Fazilnagar constituency, said that BJP workers attacked his convoy with sticks and stones during electioneering. "My driver's ear got damaged. Many vehicles were damaged and hundreds of our workers were beaten up," he added. Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav condemned the attack.

23.title: Adidas suspends partnership with Russian Football Union amid Ukraine war
23.article_body: Adidas on Tuesday suspended its partnership with the Russian Football Union (RFU) with immediate effect due to Russia's invasion of Ukraine. This comes after FIFA suspended Russia from playing any international matches and banned domestic clubs from competing in UEFA competitions. Adidas has made the Russian national team kits for both the men's and women's teams since 2008.

24.title: 29 sugar mills closed, 11 sold at low rates during SP, BSP rule: Nadda
24.article_body: BJP president Jagat Prakash Nadda on Tuesday said that both Samajwadi Party and Bahujan Samaj Party closed 29 sugar mills in Uttar Pradesh and sold 11 mills at low prices. While addressing a rally in UP's Kushinagar, Nadda said, "Yogi's government gave a payment of ₹11,000 lakh crores to sugarcane growers."

25.title: India sending medicines to Ukraine, others sending bullets: Pradhan
25.article_body: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Tuesday said while India is sending medicines to Ukraine, other nations are sending bullets. Addressing a doctors' conference in Varanasi, the minister said India is sending medical help despite being worried about its citizens' safety. He termed it as India's "new identity" while adding that the country has become a superpower in the world.

26.title: Huge scope for Cong in TN, build foundation: Rahul to party members
26.article_body: Congress' Rahul Gandhi on Monday urged the newly elected party representatives of urban local bodies in Tamil Nadu to focus on building a strong foundation for Congress, adding that there's huge opportunity for growth. Gandhi further said that while the party is in alliance with Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) in the state, it's imperative for Congress to strengthen itself organisationally.

27.title: Spain to send 150 additional troops to Latvia after Ukraine invasion
27.article_body: The Spanish Defence Ministry on Tuesday said Spain will send an additional 150 troops to Latvia as part of a NATO buildup of battlegroups in the Baltic region following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Spain said it is increasing its number of reinforcement troops in Latvia in line with NATO response plans "to preserve peace and security after the invasion".

28.title: Cinema is a fantasy world, OTT won't give that experience: Yash
28.article_body: Kannada actor Yash has said he believes in entertaining his fans on the big screen despite the rising popularity of OTT platforms. "People need entertainment in cinemas, where it is a fantasy world. OTT [platforms]...will not give you that experience," he said. "You have to leave everything aside and go into a theatre...and...that world," he added.

29.title: SUV runs over devotees on Maha Shivratri in MP; 5 people injured
29.article_body: An SUV allegedly ran over a group of devotees who had come to a temple in the Bhind district of Madhya Pradesh on the occasion of Maha Shivratri. The incident left five of the devotees, including a child, injured. The driver was reportedly beaten up by people following the incident and the vehicle was vandalised.

30.title: At least 136 civilians killed, 400 others injured in Ukraine: UN
30.article_body: The United Nations Human Rights Office on Tuesday said at least 136 civilians, including 13 children, have been killed in Ukraine with 400 civilian injuries reported. "The real toll is likely to be much higher," said Liz Throssell, a spokesperson for the UN agency. The UN World Food Programme is increasing its activity to support up to 3.1 million Ukrainians.

31.title: World silent, history repeating: Ukraine Prez as 5 die after Russia bombs TV tower
31.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy posted a tweet after Russia bombed a TV tower in Kyiv, killing at least five people. He tweeted, "To the world: What's the point of saying "never again" for 80 years, if the world stays silent when a bomb drops on the same site of Babyn Yar?" He added, "At least five killed. History repeating."

32.title: Last 3 years have taken a toll on me: Gujarat Titans' ₹2-cr buy Roy on pulling out of IPL
32.article_body: Talking about pulling out of IPL 2022, Gujarat Titans' ₹2-crore buy Jason Roy released a statement, saying, "With everything going on in the world over the last 3 years it has added up and taken its toll on me." The 31-year-old English batter added, "I feel it is only right I spend some quality time with my family."

33.title: Ship with 4,000 cars including Porsches sinks 2 weeks after catching fire mid-ocean
33.article_body: A burnt-out cargo ship carrying around 4,000 cars made by Volkswagen Group, including Lamborghinis, Porsches, Bentleys and Audis, sank on Tuesday off the Portuguese Azores archipelago. The ship sank nearly two weeks after it caught fire mid-ocean. "When the towing started...water started to come in...The ship lost its stability and sank," the captain of the nearest port said.

34.title: 'New Girl' actor Ralph Ahn passes away at 95
34.article_body: Actor Ralph Ahn, who was best known for his role as Tran in TV series 'New Girl', has died at the age of 95. His career spanned over 65 years with credits such as 1950s shows 'Terry and the Pirates', '21 Beacon Street', among several others. "RIP. So much fun to work with," Ralph's former co-actor Jake Johnson said.

35.title: Give BJP govt 5 more years to bring peace in Manipur: Amit Shah
35.article_body: Union Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday said that if voted to power, BJP "will take...steps for talks with the insurgency groups of Manipur to bring peace in the state". Shah added that BJP took similar initiatives in Tripura, and in the Bodoland and Karbi issues. He added that more than 9,500 persons associated with insurgency have given up arms.

36.title: Norway bans Russian alcohol from shops over invasion of Ukraine
36.article_body: Vinmonopolet, a state-owned alcoholic beverage retailer, said that its stores in Norway are removing Russian-made alcoholic beverages from their shelves in response to invasion of Ukraine. Notably, Vinmonopolet's shops are the only ones allowed to sell wine and hard liquor in Norway. Similar moves were announced in neighbouring Finland and Sweden, which also have state monopolies selling alcohol.

37.title: Lokomotiv Moscow manager resigns in protest against Ukraine invasion
37.article_body: Lokomotiv Moscow's manager Markus Gisdol on Tuesday said he has resigned from his position in protest against Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "I cannot pursue my calling in a country whose leader is responsible for a war of aggression in the middle of Europe," he said. The Russian club, however, stated he was dismissed. Gisdol oversaw 12 matches as manager.

38.title: 33 students from Tripura identified in Ukraine, 5 return home safely
38.article_body: Tripura Chief Secretary Kumar Alok, in a series of tweets on Tuesday, informed the public that total 33 students from the state have already been identified in Ukraine and their evacuation process is underway. In one of his posts, he wrote, "There's no need to worry about their safety." Five students from the state have reached India so far.

39.title: No Indian left in Kyiv, 60% Indians evacuated from Ukraine: Govt
39.article_body: Foreign Secretary Harsh Vardhan Shringla informed on Tuesday that all Indians have been evacuated from Kyiv, the capital of war-hit Ukraine. He said the government estimated that 20,000 Indians are in Ukraine and of them, 12,000 have been evacuated. Of the remaining 40%, most are in Kharkiv. India will operate 26 flights over next three days for evacuation, he added.

40.title: Mother-in-law once told Vipul 'Such a big director washing dishes': Shefali
40.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah has revealed her mother-in-law once saw her husband filmmaker Vipul Amrutlal Shah washing dishes and said, "Itna bada director bartan ghis raha hai (Such a big director is washing dishes)." Shefali added, "Vipul and I almost fell off laughing just hearing it. It was hilarious!" The actress further said he's as much a homemaker as she is.

41.title: Want to work with int'l musicians: Jalota on English song debut
41.article_body: After recording a track in English for the first time recently, singer Anup Jalota has said he wants to work with international musicians. "My students helped me get the accent and pronunciation right," he said. "I wish to do some work...in association with ISKCON. I want to record devotional songs in English," he added.

42.title: Shlipa Shetty shares first look of her upcoming film 'Sukhee'
42.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty on Tuesday unveiled the first poster of her upcoming film 'Sukhee'. In the first look, the actress can be seen holding various household items in her hands. "Thrilled to announce my next, in and as #Sukhee," Shilpa wrote in the caption of an Instagram post. The film is produced by Abundantia Entertainment and T-Series.

43.title: 6.6 lakh people have fled Ukraine since last week: UN agency
43.article_body: The UN refugee agency on Tuesday said that over 6.6 lakh people have fled Ukraine since the start of the Russian invasion last week. The situation looks set to become Europe's largest refugee crisis this century, it added. Some of the people arriving in Poland told UN field staff that they had waited for up to 60 hours to cross.

44.title: 'Sonchiriya' uplifted me as an actor and a human: Bhumi Pednekar
44.article_body: 'Sonchiriya', starring Sushant Singh Rajput, Bhumi Pednekar and Manoj Bajpayee, completed three years of its release on Tuesday. Taking to Instagram, Bhumi wrote, "A film that uplifted me as an actor and a human. Full of bittersweet memories. Some [of] that make me tear up even today." She posted a BTS video from the sets of the film on Instagram.

45.title: For 3 years, I was totally lost in my own sorrows: Bobby Deol
45.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol, speaking about his depressed phase, said that he was totally lost in his own sorrows for three years pitying himself. "Your family can support your whole life but they can't make you...go to work," the actor added. Bobby further spoke about nepotism, saying that a father in any industry can't help if his son fails.

46.title: Ukraine asks China to intervene to stop Russian invasion
46.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba has asked his Chinese counterpart Wang Yi to use China's ties with Russia to stop the Russian invasion of Ukraine, the Ukrainian Foreign Ministry said on Tuesday. China is ready to make every effort to help end the war through diplomacy, Wang told Kuleba. China has strong trade links with Ukraine, according to Reuters.

47.title: 5 killed after Russian forces attack Kyiv's main TV tower, signals disrupted
47.article_body: The Russian forces on Tuesday attacked the main TV tower in Ukraine’s Kyiv, potentially disrupting its signal, said Ukrainian Interior Ministry adviser Anton Herashchenko. The attack reportedly claimed the lives of five people. The TV tower was situated near a memorial site that commemorates the victims of Babyn Yar, where thousands of Jews were killed by Nazis in 1941.

48.title: In pics: Damage caused by Russia's attack on Ukraine's 2nd largest city of Kharkiv
48.article_body: The Russian forces bombarded the central square in Ukraine's second-largest city of Kharkiv on Tuesday. As per an official, rocket strikes on Kharkiv killed at least 10 people and injured 35 others. On Tuesday, Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs also shared a video on Twitter of a Russian missile attack on the administrative building in Kharkiv.

49.title: Time pass rumour: Rashmika on reports of marrying Vijay Deverakonda
49.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna has refuted reports of marrying actor Vijay Deverakonda and called it a "time pass rumour". "I still have a lot of time for marriage. I will get married when the time comes. And for all those rumours written, I am like, let them be," she added. Some media reports had claimed the duo were getting married soon.

50.title: Delhi reports 344 COVID-19 cases, 4 deaths in last 24 hrs
50.article_body: Delhi reported 344 new COVID-19 cases and four related deaths in the last 24 hours, taking the overall infection tally in the city to 18,60,236. Moreover, 416 recoveries were reported in the national capital, with the city currently having 1,769 active cases. The city had reported 258 COVID-19 cases and no related death on Monday.

51.title: Sex racket running in Indore hotel busted, 15 members arrested
51.article_body: A crime branch team busted a sex racket running at a hotel in Indore, Madhya Pradesh, and arrested 15 people involved in it. Seven women and eight men were held after police raided the Rajputana Hotel in the Banganga area on Monday based on a tip-off. Police reportedly sealed all exit routes to bust the racket.

52.title: France to offer €100 mn in financial aid to Ukraine amid invasion
52.article_body: France will offer €100 million in financial aid to Ukraine amid ongoing Russian military offensive, French Foreign Ministry said on Tuesday. The aid, which comes in response to request by Ukraine, aims to relieve humanitarian crisis in country, ministry added. First shipment of 33 tonnes of aid, including sleeping bags and hygiene kits, was handed over to Ukraine on Monday.

53.title: Kashmir establishes helpline for students, residents stuck in Ukraine
53.article_body: The Divisional Administration Kashmir has established a helpline for residents or students of Kashmir who have been stranded in Ukraine. It was issued on Tuesday to provide the Kashmiri residents assistance from government. According to the administration, the concerned and their family members can contact on phone numbers, 01942457312 and 01942473135, in case help is needed from government.

54.title: After 14 years in custody, SC grants bail to a murder case convict
54.article_body: The Supreme Court has granted bail to a convict, Ritu Pal, in a murder case after observing that he has spent over 14 years in jail. The bench headed by CJI NV Ramana observed that Pal has undergone "about 17 years of total custody with remission". Notably, Pal's bail plea had been pending in the Allahabad High Court since 2012.

55.title: AFSPA extended for another 6 months in Assam
55.article_body: The Assam government on Tuesday extended the Armed Forces (Special Powers) Act, 1958 (AFSPA) for another six months with effect from February 28. An official statement said that the AFSPA was extended after reviewing the law and order situation in Assam in the past six months. The state has been declared a "disturbed area" for up to six months.

56.title: 26 flights scheduled to bring back Indians from Ukraine over next 3 days: Govt
56.article_body: Foreign Secretary Harsh Vardhan Shringla on Tuesday said that 26 flights have been scheduled over the next three days to bring Indian citizens who have moved from Ukraine to the neighbouring countries. Apart from Bucharest and Budapest, airports in Poland and Slovakia will also be used, he added. Around 12,000 Indian students out of 20,000 have left Ukraine, he stated.

57.title: Putin's a fu****g animal, wish he was dead like Hitler: Howard Stern
57.article_body: American radio personality Howard Stern criticised Russian President Vladimir Putin for launching an invasion into Ukraine. Howard also questioned the ex-US President Donald Trump praising Putin and called the Russian President a "fu****g animal." He further added, "I wish he was dead like I wish Hitler was dead." Howard also called Putin a s*****g who would enslave an entire country.

58.title: Don't think captaincy was ever a burden on Kohli: Gavaskar
58.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said that Virat Kohli was never affected by the burden of captaincy as he was scoring hundreds just every other innings. "As a captain what happens is that you are concerned about everybody else. It's just a natural thing," he stated. India-Sri Lanka first Test in Mohali will mark 100th Test for Kohli.

59.title: Communal polarisation only weapon left with BJP to win polls: Yechury
59.article_body: Communist Party of India (Marxist) General Secretary Sitaram Yechury has said that communal polarisation is the only weapon left with the BJP to win the elections. He said, "Instead of addressing the problem of the people the only focus of the BJP is to sharpen communal polarisation." Yechury said the country is witnessing a "systematic assault of the Indian Constitution".

60.title: Assam Police seize heroin worth ₹4 cr, drug peddler injured in firing
60.article_body: Assam Police shot at a drug peddler when he reportedly tried to escape and seized heroin worth ₹4 crores from his possession, police said on Tuesday. The peddler was stopped at the Jagiroad police checkpoint around 9 pm on Monday, Morigaon district Superintendent of Police Aparna N said. The accused was later shifted to Gauhati Medical College and Hospital.

61.title: Russian planes rerouted after attempting to enter Canadian airspace
61.article_body: Canadian air-traffic control service, NAV CANADA said two Russian planes which were attempting to enter Canadian airspace on Monday were rerouted by US' Federal Aviation Administration after the planes identified themselves as "humanitarian flights". This comes as Canada banned all Russian planes from its airspace on February 27 as part of sanctions on Russia due to its invasion of Ukraine.

62.title: Russian invasion of Ukraine is 'brutal aggression': Prince Charles
62.article_body: Prince Charles, heir to British throne, has called Russian invasion of Ukraine a "brutal aggression" and expressed solidarity with Ukrainians who are resisting the attack. The Russian assault represents an unconscionable attack on democracy and freedom, he added. Prince Charles' son William and his wife Kate also said earlier that they stood with Ukrainians as they "bravely fight" against Russia.

63.title: 24-yr-old man arrested with smack worth ₹1 crore in Rajasthan
63.article_body: A 24-year-old man was arrested after being found in possession of 600 gm of smack worth ₹1 crore in the international market, police said on Tuesday. The accused was found hiding the drug in his bag during a routine checking of a Rajasthan Roadways bus, in which he was travelling from Udaipur to Sanchore, police said.

64.title: Conditions not alien to me: Bumrah on preparing for home Test series vs SL
64.article_body: Asked about his preparations for upcoming home Test series against Sri Lanka, India Test vice-captain Jasprit Bumrah said conditions are not alien to him as he has played a lot of Ranji Trophy cricket. "It's always a special feeling to play Test cricket, be it anywhere...it's all about endurance and patience," he added. First Test begins on Friday in Mohali.

65.title: Australian PM Scott Morrison tests positive for COVID-19
65.article_body: Australian PM Scott Morrison on Tuesday said he has tested positive for COVID-19. "I am experiencing flu-like symptoms and will be recovering over next week," Morrison stated. He added he will continue with his official duties in isolation. Earlier on Tuesday, Morrison held a news briefing with Defence Minister Peter Dutton over military aid to Ukraine amid war with Russia.

66.title: Tamil Nadu CM launches skill development scheme for students
66.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin on Tuesday launched a skill development scheme for students in the state. The scheme aims to hone the educational skills and knowledge of 10 lakh youth annually and is titled 'Naan Muthalvan' (I am first). With the launch coinciding with his birthday, Stalin described the initiative as his dream scheme.

67.title: Maha to see if it can provide medical education like Ukraine, Russia
67.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Amit Deshmukh on Tuesday said the state government has taken note of the fee structures for medical education in Russia and Ukraine. He added that officials have been asked to see if such facilities can be provided to students in the state. Deshmukh said the government will study the reasons for students travelling abroad for education.

68.title: Adani Group forays into media business with minority stake in Quintillion
68.article_body: Adani Group will acquire a minority stake in Quintillion Business Media (QBM) Private Limited as it ventures in the news industry. A joint statement by the two companies said their relationship "marks a strong beginning of Adani Group's foray into Indian media". The deal is only limited to QBM and not any other products of QBM's parent company Quint.

69.title: Efforts on till all students are brought back from Ukraine: Mandaviya
69.article_body: Union Health Minister Dr Mansukh Mandaviya welcomed the Indian students at Delhi airport on Tuesday and said the government's efforts to repatriate stranded students will continue till all of them are brought back. "Many of your friends are still stuck in Ukraine, tell them efforts are being made to bring them back home," he further said.

70.title: BJP providing 24-hour electricity as SP built power plants: Akhilesh
70.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Tuesday said BJP is "able to give electricity for 24 hours only because [SP] had set up electricity plants". "BJP has sold airports, aeroplanes, railway stations. They're doing it so that no one gets employment," Yadav said. He added that instead of doubling farmers' income, BJP "stole the urea" meant for them.

71.title: 4 men rape minor after getting her addicted to drugs in Chennai; held
71.article_body: Four men have been arrested for allegedly repeatedly raping a minor girl after getting her addicted to drugs in Chennai. The girl, reportedly a Class 8 student, got addicted to cannabis after one of the accused befriended her and introduced it to her. The accused were reportedly identified as college students Vasanth and Vishal, Rejith and college lecturer Prasanna.

72.title: 440 killed in violence in South Sudan's Tambura last year: UN
72.article_body: The UN in a report said that at least 440 people were killed in violence between warring parties in South Sudan's Tambura between June and September last year. The violence was allegedly instigated, facilitated and aided by high-ranking military officials and community and religious leaders, it added. Some 80,000 people were forced to flee their homes, it further said.

73.title: Ukrainian journalist breaks down before UK's PM, says 'You are afraid'
73.article_body: Ukrainian journalist Daria Kaleniuk broke down before UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson while urging him to do more amid the Russian invasion of Ukraine, and said, "You're not coming to Kyiv or Lviv because you are afraid!" She added, "Because NATO is not willing to defend. Because NATO is afraid of World War 3 - but it has already started."

74.title: Joy of being an actor: Shefali on playing Akshay's mother in her 20s
74.article_body: Talking about playing the role of Akshay Kumar's mother in the 2005 film 'Waqt: The Race Against Time', Shefali Shah said, "Joy of being an actor, is...you play the roles...you're not." Shefali stated she did 'Waqt' so she could work with Amitabh Bachchan and her husband Vipul Amrutlal Shah. Shefali was 28 years old when she accepted the role.

75.title: Cong couldn't bring an AIIMS to Manipur in 15 yrs: Amit Shah
75.article_body: While addressing a rally in Manipur's Thoubal, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that Congress couldn't bring an All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) to Manipur in 15 years. "We have announced to build an AIIMS as soon as we form the government again," he added. Shah said that BJP has been working for the growth of Manipur's economy.

76.title: Southampton boss Hasenhuttl says tough to focus on football amid war
76.article_body: Southampton manager Ralph Hasenhuttl said the invasion of Ukraine by Russia "affects us all", adding it has been tough to focus on his job as a football manager amid the ongoing war. Southampton host West Ham United in the FA Cup on Wednesday. "It's a human catastrophe what happens and every team has players that are affected," he said.

77.title: Reliance buys majority stake in designer brand Abraham & Thakore
77.article_body: Reliance Retail on Tuesday announced it has acquired a majority stake in designer brand Abraham & Thakore (A&T) for an undisclosed amount. A&T's founders Rakesh Thakore, Kevin Nigli and David Abraham will continue to lead the creative direction of the brand, the company said. Reliance has recently invested in several designer labels including Ritu Kumar and Manish Malhotra's companies.

78.title: I am as strong in real life as on the field: Babita on 'Lock Upp'
78.article_body: Talking about her show 'Lock Upp', wrestler Babita Phogat has said that it'll be the first time that people will witness her real self. "Jaisi dhakad khel ke maidan mein hu, waise hi real mein bhi hu (I'm as strong in real life as on the field)," she added. Poonam Pandey and Munawar Faruqui are among the other contestants.

79.title: Ukraine releases instructions on safest places to hide at home; shares pic
79.article_body: Ukraine on Tuesday tweeted instructions for people in the country about the safest places in their houses amid Russian invasion. "A place behind two blank walls (the first takes the blow, the second blocks the wreckage). Room without windows (bathroom, if there is no gas equipment)," it stated. It added that windows must be shut tightly and sealed with film.

80.title: 616 Indians return from Ukraine on IndiGo, Air India Express flights
80.article_body: As many as 616 Indian nationals who were stranded in Ukraine returned to India on three evacuation flights from Romania's capital Bucharest and Hungary's Budapest on Tuesday. Two of the flights were operated by IndiGo, while one was run by Air India Express. The Indian Embassy in Ukraine advised all Indian nationals to leave Kyiv urgently on Tuesday itself.

81.title: Russian music conductor fired by Munich over support for Putin
81.article_body: The city of Munich announced on Tuesday that it has fired Valery Gergiev as the chief conductor of the city's philharmonic orchestra over his support for Russian President Vladimir Putin. Gergiev has also been dropped as conductor of the Verbier Festival, the Edinburgh International Festival, the Vienna Philharmonic's five-concert US tour among other engagements amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

82.title: 'Bhagwa' is identity of 'Bhartiyata' & India's energy: UP CM Yogi
82.article_body: Addressing the public during a roadshow in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur, Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath said, "This 'Bhagwa' is the identity of 'Bhartiyata' [Indianness] and India's energy." The CM said, "I feel proud after wearing it because Swami Vivekananda had worn his 'Bhagwa' on the international stage...but some people are targeting Bhagwa." The BJP has fielded Yogi Adityanath from Gorakhpur.

83.title: Switzerland breaks 207-yr-old policy of neutrality to impose sanctions on Russia
83.article_body: Switzerland has broken away from its long-standing policy of neutrality after 207 years and agreed to adopt all the sanctions that the EU has imposed on Russia, due to its invasion of Ukraine. Accordingly, the Swiss assets of certain Russian people and companies will be frozen. "We're in an extraordinary situation where extraordinary measures could be decided," said Swiss President.

84.title: Ranveer Singh meets fan with his face tattooed on back, says 'Wow'
84.article_body: A video is going viral on social media showing actor Ranveer Singh meeting a fan who got his face tattooed on his back. Ranveer can be heard saying "Kya baat (Wow)" after seeing the tattoo. The fan said that he has been waiting a year to meet the actor, to which Ranveer replied, "Chalo mil gaye (We've met now)."

85.title: Doubles match vs Nielsen will be tough: Bopanna ahead of Davis Cup
85.article_body: Ahead of India's Davis Cup World Group-I playoff tie against Denmark, doubles player Rohan Bopanna said the doubles match is going to be a tough one. He added that Denmark team's captain Frederik Nielsen is an "extremely fantastic doubles player" and brings in a lot of experience. The tournament will be played on March 4-5 at Delhi Gymkhana Club.

86.title: Poland refuses to send fighter jets to Ukraine amid war with Russia
86.article_body: Poland President Andrzej Duda on Tuesday said Poland won't send fighter jets to Ukraine amid war with Russia. "We are not sending any jets to Ukraine because that would open a military interference in Ukrainian conflict," added Duda. Duda added NATO is not a party to the conflict. However, he said Poland has been supporting Ukraine with humanitarian aid.

87.title: 11 people killed in fire at mall in Syria's Damascus
87.article_body: At least 11 people were killed in a fire at a mall in Syria's capital Damascus on Tuesday, the Syrian Interior Ministry said. The fire caused significant damage and investigations to find out the cause are underway, it added. Many of the victims were security guards or staff who were on duty overnight in the building, a senior official said.

88.title: Evacuate us: 66 Indian students stuck in southern Ukraine to govt
88.article_body: Sixty-six Indian students stuck at a hostel of Petro Mohyla Black Sea National University in southern Ukraine's Mykolaiv on Tuesday urged the Indian Embassy to evacuate them. "We don't have sufficient food and the weather has been very cold," one student said. He added one batch was evacuated but they are waiting for a bus to reach neighbouring Moldova.

89.title: Kohli's 100th Test not to be played behind closed doors, 50% crowd to be allowed
89.article_body: The upcoming India-Sri Lanka Test which will mark Virat Kohli's 100th Test will not be played behind closed doors, BCCI Secretary Jay Shah confirmed, reversing an earlier decision. Fans will be allowed in 50% capacity inside the IS Bindra Punjab Cricket Association (PCA) Stadium in Mohali, the state association confirmed. The match will begin on March 4.

90.title: Burkina Faso approves transition charter, to hold polls in 3 years
90.article_body: Burkina Faso's national conference on Tuesday approved a charter allowing a military-led transition period of three years before the country holds polls. Signed by Lieutenant-Colonel Paul-Henri Damiba, the military junta leader, the charter will establish a government of 25 ministers and a parliament of 71 members. In January, President Roch Kabore was ousted by a military coup led by Damiba.

91.title: Greece backs EU sanctions against Russia, will host Ukrainians: PM
91.article_body: Greece PM Kyriakos Mitsotakis told the parliament on Tuesday that the country supports European Union's (EU) sanctions against Russia and is ready to host Ukrainian refugees amid the invasion. "Greece was always on the right side of history...we are on the side of Ukraine, freedom and democracy," PM Mitsotakis said. Mitsotakis also called for enhanced defence cooperation among EU countries.

92.title: 3 US states to end mask mandates in schools after March 11
92.article_body: Governors of California, Oregon and Washington on Monday said their states will remove mask mandates in school after March 11. "As we learn to live with this virus, we must remain vigilant," Oregon Governor Kate Brown said. Similar moves were made by other states after US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) on Friday eased its indoor mask guidelines.

93.title: Arvind Kejriwal condoles death of Indian student killed in Ukraine
93.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday condoled the death of 21-year-old Indian medical student Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar, who died in shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv. Kejriwal took to Twitter and said, "Feel terrible to hear this news. Prayers for his family." "Pray for the safety of all other Indians stranded and hope they will be back home soon," he tweeted.

94.title: Prez Kovind cancels visit to Serbia, Jamaica & Saint Vincent: Report
94.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind has reportedly cancelled his three-nation tour to Serbia, Jamaica and Saint Vincent and the Grenadines. The tour, which was scheduled to begin on Wednesday, was reportedly cancelled after President Kovind met Prime Minister Narendra Modi on the sidelines of an event at the Rashtrapati Bhavan. However, the Ministry of External Affairs is yet to confirm it.

95.title: Russia's Miranchuk holds his head down, refuses to celebrate goal in Serie A match
95.article_body: Russian forward Aleksei Miranchuk held his head down and refused to celebrate after scoring his club Atalanta's fourth goal in their 4-0 victory against Sampdoria in Serie A. Miranchuk's goal came hours after Russian national team was suspended from qualifying matches for the FIFA World Cup amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

96.title: Who is Olena Zelenska, wife of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy?
96.article_body: Ukraine's First Lady Olena Zelenska, 44, has studied architecture before she changed her profession to writing. She met Volodymyr Zelenskyy at a university where they both were students. They got married in 2003, after eight years of dating and have two children aged 17 and eight. Zelenska now works as a screenwriter for Studio Quarter 95, a Ukrainian production company.

97.title: I’m feeling in a good space: Steve Smith ahead of Pak Test series
97.article_body: Australia vice-captain Steve Smith on Tuesday said he is "feeling in a good space" ahead of the Test series against Pakistan, following a concussion he sustained last month. Australia will tour Pakistan for the first time since 1998. They will play three Tests, three ODIs and one T20I in Pakistan. "Getting accustomed to the conditions is really important," Smith said.

98.title: He is allowed to have a couple of bad games: Dimitar Berbatov on Ronaldo
98.article_body: Former Manchester United player Dimitar Berbatov has said ex-teammate Cristiano Ronaldo is "allowed to have a couple of bad games", as Ronaldo's recent form has led to one goal in 2022. "Everybody in United team needs to produce more, the standards should be a lot higher than they are," Berbatov said. Manchester United are fourth on the Premier League table.

99.title: Indian Navy performs skit depicting INS Jalashwa at Goa Carnival
99.article_body: The Indian Navy participated in the Goa Carnival in Vasco-da-Gama on Monday. The Navy presented a short skit and displayed a tableau depicting the amphibious ship INS Jalashwa used in the 'Operation Samudra Setu' to provide aid during the Covid-19 pandemic. The tableau also reflected the theme of the Navy Week 2021: 'Indian Navy - Combat Ready, Credible and Cohesive'.

100.title: No water tariff hike in Chandigarh this year: Mayor
100.article_body: Chandigarh Mayor Sarbjit Kaur Dhillon has assured there will be no increase in the city's water tariff in the coming fiscal year. "I...met the UT administrator and requested that the tariff be kept the same," she said during the General House meeting on Monday. "If needed, I will take along all...councillors to meet the administrator on the issue," she added.

101.title: Putin's tanks only bring suffering & destruction: German minister
101.article_body: German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock on Monday said Russia’s invasion of Ukraine is a "terrible turning point", adding, "Putin’s tanks only bring suffering and destruction." Baerbock said Europe stands together to help Ukraine as “no one believes the propaganda” of Russian President Vladimir Putin. Baerbock added, "Putin’s tanks don’t bring water. Putin’s tanks definitely don’t bring peace."

102.title: Thousands of Australians told to evacuate homes due to heavy floods
102.article_body: Across Australia's southeast coast, thousands of people were ordered to evacuate their homes by Tuesday as the region experiences heavy rainfall and the worst flooding in decades. Police said at least nine people have died so far. Australia's Bureau of Meteorology said Sydney could receive on Tuesday up to 15 cm of rain within a six-hour period.

103.title: European Council chief talks to PM, condoles Indian student's death in Ukraine
103.article_body: European Council chief Charles Michel said on Tuesday that he spoke with PM Narendra Modi and expressed his condolences to the latter for the death of Indian student Naveen in Kharkiv. "European countries are wholeheartedly helping Indian citizens to evacuate from Ukraine," said Michel. The 21-year-old medical student from Karnataka lost his life in Russian shelling today.

104.title: Don't think Team India is fully prepared for 2022 T20 WC: Rajkumar
104.article_body: Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma has said Team India are not fully prepared for 2022 T20 World Cup in Australia, adding there's still a lot of preparation required. "Our best XI hasn't even played one or two times...once you play your XI, then only you'll come to know what are the shortcomings and where improvement is required," he added.

105.title: Medvedev becoming world no. 1 is a good thing for tennis: Amritraj
105.article_body: Former tennis player Prakash Amritraj said it is good for tennis that Daniil Medvedev is the new world number one. Amritraj added he does not believe another "Big 3" will be as dominant in the sport in the future. "This is a super exciting time for the men's game. I am all for it, I am super pumped," he said.

106.title: BJP govt washing its hands off India's job crisis: Sitaram Yechury
106.article_body: CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury on Tuesday accused the BJP of "washing its hands off" India's job crisis. Yechury's remark came in response to an interview of Union Home Minister Amit Shah, where latter reportedly said, 'Communists consider only government jobs as employment'. "Privatisation destroys job reservations...[It pushes] India back by centuries, economically and socially," Yechury added.

107.title: UP saw 700 riots under SP rule before 2017: UP CM Yogi Adityanath
107.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath has said the BJP government wants everyone's development, while Samajwadi Party's leadership and BSP only want their development. Addressing an election rally in Siddharthnagar, Yogi said that before 2017, UP reported 700 riots under the SP government and over 300 riots under the BSP government. However, no riot was reported under the BJP government, he added.

108.title: We have to make India 'Vishwa Guru': RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat
108.article_body: During a book launch event in Delhi, Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) chief Mohan Bhagwat on Tuesday said, "We have to make India stand before the world [and] we have to make it 'Vishwa Guru'." "If we want to build a reputation of India, then we'll have to establish its antiquity and the truth from ancient times till date," he added.

109.title: Uttarakhand's Kedarnath Temple to open for devotees on May 6
109.article_body: Portals of the Kedarnath Temple in Uttarakhand will be opened for devotees at 6.25 am on May 6. The date and timing were announced after a religious ceremony at Omkareshwar Temple on the occasion of Maha Shivaratri on Tuesday. The temple gates will be opened in 'Vrishchik Lagna', Badri-Kedar temple committee official Harish Gaud said.

110.title: Naveen postponed travel to India so that juniors weren't left behind: Friend
110.article_body: A friend of 21-year-old Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar, who died in shelling in Ukraine on Tuesday, said the latter had postponed his travel to India so that his juniors aren't left behind in the country. Amit Vaishyar said Naveen wanted to leave for India on Wednesday, instead of Monday, along with juniors who were less than a year old in Ukraine.

111.title: First batch of 32 Himachal students returns from war-hit Ukraine
111.article_body: The first batch of 32 students of Himachal Pradesh, who were stuck in war-torn Ukraine, landed in Delhi in a special flight on Sunday evening. The Himachal Pradesh government deployed buses to take the students back to their home districts. The returnees said the situation in Ukraine is grim, particularly in the main cities.

112.title: Australia committed $50 mn to fund lethal weapons for Ukraine: PM
112.article_body: Australian PM Scott Morrison on Tuesday announced that Australia has committed A$70 million (Over $50 million) to fund lethal defensive weapons for Ukraine. "We're talking missiles, we're talking ammunition, we're talking supporting them in their defence of their own homeland...and we will be doing that in partnership with NATO," Morrison said. The weapons would be delivered rapidly, he added.

113.title: I didn't recognise my voice in Doctor Strange 2 trailer: Patrick Stewart
113.article_body: Veteran actor Patrick Stewart, who portrays Professor X in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, has seemingly confirmed his cameo in upcoming film 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness'. "I actually didn't recognise my own voice [in the trailer]...I was astonished and all [audience] saw was the back of my shoulder and...my earlobe...But uh, it pleased me," the actor said.

114.title: Russia says Meta, Google should be held accountable for inciting war
114.article_body: The Russian Foreign Ministry on Tuesday said western technological giants like Meta Platforms Inc and Alphabet's Google should be held responsible for "inciting war", news agency Interfax reported. Russian communications agency Roskomnadzor also demanded an end to discrimination against Russian media in Europe. Google recently blocked Russian media outlet RT and other channels from monetising ads.

115.title: 2 realtors shot dead on Hyderabad outskirts, hunt on to nab killers
115.article_body: Two real estate businessmen have been shot dead on the outskirts of Hyderabad. Police said the city-based realtors, who were partners in business, were shot at by unidentified assailants on Tuesday. An official said that while one of them died on spot, the other was rushed to hospital and pronounced dead there. A search is on to nab the killers.

116.title: It's like massacre arranged by Mughals against Rajputs: Ukraine on Russian invasion
116.article_body: Amid Russia-Ukraine war, Ukrainian Ambassador Igor Polikha on Tuesday said, "It (Russian invasion) is like the massacre arranged by Mughals against Rajputs." "We are asking every time all influential world leaders, among them Modi Ji, to use every resource against Putin to stop bombing and shelling," he added. He also thanked India for starting humanitarian aid to Ukraine.

117.title: Manjrekar gets protection from arrest by Bombay HC in obscenity case
117.article_body: Bombay High Court has granted director-actor Mahesh Manjrekar protection from arrest in a case over the alleged shooting of obscene scenes involving minors in his Marathi film 'Nay Varan Bhat Loncha Kon Nay Koncha'. Earlier, an FIR was registered against the film's director Manjrekar and the team under the provisions of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act.

118.title: Civic poll violence in Bengal send out wrong message: TMC MP
118.article_body: Reacting to reports of violence amid civic body elections in Bengal, Trinamool Congress (TMC) MP Saugata Roy said that such incidents should have been avoided as they send "wrong message among masses". "We (TMC) will win based on...work done by us, there's no need for...violence," he added. As many as 108 municipalities in the state went to polls on Sunday.

119.title: Hyd Traffic Police offers discount on pending challans from March 1
119.article_body: A one-time discount on traffic challans pending against motorists is being offered by traffic police in Telangana to provide respite to vehicle owners. Hyderabad Traffic Police Joint Commissioner AV Ranganath said the decision was taken considering financial troubles faced by many due to the COVID-19 lockdowns in last two years. The discount will be applicable from March 1 to 31.

120.title: Second round of Russia-Ukraine talks to be held on March 2: Report
120.article_body: The second round of talks between Russia and Ukraine is planned for March 2, reported Russia’s TASS news agency. The first round of negotiations had taken place on the Ukrainian-Belarusian border near the Pripyat river on Monday. The meeting had ended conclusively while both sides said they would meet again in the coming days.

121.title: Shahid's sister Sanah to marry Mayank Pahwa in Mahabaleshwar: Report
121.article_body: Veteran actors Pankaj Kapur and Supriya Pathak's daughter and actor Shahid Kapoor's half-sister Sanah Kapur will get married to actors Manoj Pahwa and Seema Pahwa's son Mayank Pahwa on Wednesday in Mahabaleshwar, reported Pinkvilla. The report stated that the mehendi and sangeet functions were scheduled for Tuesday. Sanah and Mayank reportedly got engaged in January 2017.

122.title: PM Modi chairs 4th high-level meeting in 48 hrs on Ukraine crisis
122.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday chaired a high-level meeting on the Ukraine crisis after Russian invasion, the fourth such meeting to be held in the last 48 hours. The meeting was called after India confirmed that a 21-year-old Karnataka native, Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar, died in shelling in Ukraine. Earlier, PM Modi also spoke with Naveen's family and offered his condolences.

123.title: BJP MP meets family of Karnataka student killed in Ukraine
123.article_body: Shivkumar Udasi, BJP MP from Haveri in Karnataka, on Tuesday met with the family of Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar who died in shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv amid the Russian invasion. "He was standing in the queue before a grocery shop when the Russian army fired at people," Naveen's friend said. "We'll try to bring his body to India," Karnataka CM said.

124.title: Interpreter breaks down while translating Ukrainian President's speech to EU
124.article_body: An interpreter for a news channel broke down and cried while translating Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's address to the European Parliament on Tuesday. CNN's interpreter is heard sniffling while translating Zelenskyy's speech detailing the deaths of children and the toll of the Russian invasion. "This is the price of freedom," the interpreter said while passing on Zelenskyy's message.

125.title: I'm glad Sanjay Kapoor is getting his due: Arjun on 'The Fame Game'
125.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor said he's excited to see his uncle and actor Sanjay Kapoor doing series like 'The Fame Game'. "From seeing 'Akhiyaan Milaoon Kabhi' (song in film 'Raja') as a kid to...seeing the show with Madhuri Dixit and Sanjay chachu, it's like life coming full circle for him," Arjun stated. Arjun added he's glad Sanjay is getting his due.

126.title: Extreme climate conditions can cause mental health issues: UN panel
126.article_body: UN's Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) report released on Monday said extreme climate conditions can cause mental health issues like anxiety, depression, acute traumatic stress etc. Citing some studies, report said mental health problems increased by 0.5% when average temperatures exceeded 30 degree celsius. It also found increased risk of suicide with rise in ambient temperature.

127.title: Germany aims to fulfil all power needs via renewable sources by 2035
127.article_body: Germany has aimed to fulfil all of its electricity needs through renewable sources by 2035, a government draft paper stated. According to the draft paper, the share of wind or solar power should reach 80% by 2030. This comes after government considered extending life-spans of coal and nuclear plants to cut dependency on Russian gas on February 27.

128.title: Indian embassy didn't reach out to students in Kharkiv: Father of Indian who died
128.article_body: The father of 21-year-old Naveen Shekarappa Gyanagoudar, a medical student from Karnataka who lost his life in shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv, alleged that no one from the Indian Embassy reached out to stranded Indian students in Kharkiv. His uncle claimed that Naveen was killed when he stepped out of his bunker to exchange currency and fetch some food.

129.title: 100th Test another feather in Kohli's cap: Bumrah ahead of Mohali Test
129.article_body: Talking about ex-India captain Virat Kohli playing his 100th Test in Mohali against Sri Lanka, beginning Friday, India Test vice-captain Jasprit Bumrah said, "It's another feather in his (Kohli's) cap." He added, "It's always a special achievement for a player...it's a testimony to his hard-work, dedication." Notably, Bumrah made his Test debut under Kohli in 2018.

130.title: Will deny port call of US sanctioned Russian oil tanker: Malaysia
130.article_body: Malaysian government on Tuesday said Russian-flagged oil tanker, Linda which was targeted by US sanctions will not be allowed to call at Kuala Linggi port. "The government will continue to review the situation for further action as may be required according to current government policies," the transport ministry added. However, the authorities didn't state government's position on US sanctions.

131.title: Pakistan logs 861 new COVID-19 cases, 18 deaths in last 24 hours
131.article_body: Pakistani authorities on Tuesday said the country reported 861 new daily COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours. As per Pakistan's National Command and Operation Centre (NCOC), 18 new deaths were recorded taking total death toll to over 30,000. NCOC added out of 37,087 active cases, 988 patients were critical. Meanwhile, positivity rate has dropped to 2.29% from 2.56%.

132.title: Ensure no more lives are lost in Russia-Ukraine conflict: J'khand CM
132.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren on Tuesday said that he is "deeply saddened" after Naveen Gyanagoudar, an Indian student, was killed in shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv. CM Soren said, "Our thoughts and prayers are with the family members of the deceased student." He further urged PM Narendra Modi to ensure that no more lives are lost in the ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict.

133.title: What is Wagner Group, the Russian mercenaries said to be in Kyiv to kill Ukraine Prez?
133.article_body: Mercenaries from Wagner Group, a Russian private military company recently sanctioned by EU over human rights abuses, are reportedly in Kyiv to assassinate Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. The company is believed to be used by Kremlin to carry out its strategic objectives, even though Russia denied such claims. Wagner was reportedly involved in beheading of Syria army deserters in 2017.

134.title: 34-hour wait at -5°C was worst part: Bihar student on return from Ukraine
134.article_body: A Bihar resident who returned from Ukraine on Tuesday said the worst part was the 34-hour wait at the Ukraine-Romania border. "I couldn't eat, drink or sleep. The temperature was -3°C to -5°C," the 21-year-old student added. He further said that there was no toilet or place to sleep and he saw some girls falling unconscious.

135.title: Reaffirms commitment to service: Odisha CM on BJD win in rural polls
135.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik on Tuesday said that the massive mandate for the BJD in the three-tier panchayat elections has strengthened the party's commitment to public service. The BJD has won in 766 of the 851 Zilla Parishad zones where the elections were held. "I thank the people from the core of my heart for their...support to...BJD candidates," Patnaik tweeted.

136.title: Shahid Kapoor charges ₹38 cr for film with Ali Abbas Zafar: Report
136.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor has reportedly charged ₹38 crore as his fee for his upcoming untitled action film with director Ali Abbas Zafar. "This is around 25% more than 'Jersey' and more than twice of what he had fetched for...'Kabir Singh'," a trade source told Bollywood Hungama. Shahid Kapoor began shooting for the film in November last year.

137.title: Pakistan-Australia series set to be played with 100% crowd capacity
137.article_body: Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has been allowed by National Command and Operation Centre (NCOC) to conduct the all-format series between Pakistan and Australia in front of a 100% capacity crowd due to reduction in COVID-19 cases across the country. The series is scheduled to take place from March 4 to April 5, 2022, beginning with the first Test in Rawalpindi.

138.title: Dean of Kerala drama school arrested for raping student in his home
138.article_body: School of Drama and Fine Arts' Dean S Sunil Kumar was arrested in Thrissur on Tuesday for allegedly raping a student in his home on January 21. The victim lived with Kumar and his partner as she couldn't travel to her hometown. After the victim allegedly attempted suicide and mentioned the incident in the hospital, Kumar called her "mentally unstable".

139.title: We've a desire to see our kids alive, I think it's a fair one: Zelenskyy to EU
139.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy addressed the European Parliament on Tuesday, the sixth day of the Russian invasion. Appealing to the European Union to "prove you're with us", Zelenskyy said, "We have a desire to see our children alive. I think it's a fair one." He added, "We're fighting...for our land...our freedom, despite the fact that all [our] cities...are now blocked."

140.title: At one time, I didn't have ₹1,500 to pay for kid's school: Urvashi
140.article_body: Actress Urvashi Dholakia has revealed that during her late teens, she required ₹3,000 but was paid half as makers said she only shot the first episode. "You feel 'What am I gonna do, I don't have ₹1,500 to pay for my child's education'," the actress added. Urvashi further said that looking back, she feels she has done well for herself.

141.title: Officials deployed to help Ukraine evacuees return home: K'taka CM
141.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Tuesday said the state has deployed two officials in Mumbai and New Delhi, to help Karnataka students arriving from Ukraine reach home without any hassle. "The Romanian border is getting crowded and a request has been made to make separate arrangements for Kannadigas," the CM added.

142.title: PM2.5 pollution-related deaths in India rose 2.5 times in 20 yrs: Report
142.article_body: Deaths due to PM2.5 pollution in India increased 2.5 times in the last two decades, according to a report by Centre for Science and Environment. The report, released by Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav, said India accounted for one of every four air pollution-related deaths in 2019. It added that 6.67 million people died due to air pollution in the world.

143.title: This board has no authority to even call my peon: BharatPe's Ashneer Grover
143.article_body: BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover, who resigned as company's MD and board director, said, "I live life on my own terms. This board has no authority to even call my peon." He said, "I don't acknowledge this board. It's a contravention of every single law of the land." He added, "I will take this up to the Ministry of Corporate Affairs."

144.title: Do prove that you are with us: Ukrainian President asks for support from EU
144.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Tuesday urged the European Union to prove it supported the country amid the Russian invasion. "Do prove that you are with us. Do prove that you will not let us go. Do prove that you are indeed Europeans and then life will win over death and light will win over darkness," he said.

145.title: Hungary supports bid for Ukraine to become part of EU: Minister
145.article_body: Hungary is supporting an initiative by eight European Union (EU) leaders to start membership talks with Ukraine, Hungarian Foreign Minister Péter Szijjártó said on Tuesday, adding that Brussels should "put the issue on agenda". Presidents of Poland, Lithuania, Latvia and five other countries have called for expedited EU candidate status for Ukraine. Ukraine has signed an application to join EU.

146.title: PM Modi to unveil Shivaji Maharaj's statue in Pune on March 6
146.article_body: PM Narendra Modi during his visit to Pune on March 6 (Sunday) is likely to travel by metro rail and also unveil Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj's statue at Pune Municipal Corporation headquarters, BJP office-bearers said. He will also inaugurate the two priority stretches of the metro rail project between Garware college to Vanaz and Dapodi to Pimpri, Mayor Murlidhar Mohol said.

147.title: Rohit Sharma buys personalised Lamborghini Urus worth over ₹3.10 crore, pics surface
147.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma has bought a personalised Lamborghini Urus car worth over ₹3.10 crore. The Blu Eleos Metallic Urus comes with a 22-inch Nath diamond-cut rims and Sportivo Leather interior in Nero Ade/Rosso Alala. Rohit also owns a BMW X3, Toyota Fortuner and a Skoda Laura, which was his first-ever car.

148.title: Saurabh Chaudhary wins gold in shooting World Cup, Russian flag removed from points table
148.article_body: India's 19-year-old Saurabh Chaudhary won the gold medal after defeating Germany's Michael Schwald in the final of 10 metre Air Pistol at ISSF Shooting World Cup in Cairo. The bronze medal in the event was won by Russia's Artem Chernousov. The Russian flag and country's name were removed beside Artem's name over Russia's ongoing war with Ukraine.

149.title: 'No Entry Mein Entry' completely depends on Salman Khan: Boney Kapoor
149.article_body: Bollywood producer Boney Kapoor has said that the sequel to the 2005 film 'No Entry' can only be made with actor Salman Khan. Boney stated that the script of the sequel is ready. "But 'No Entry Mein Entry' completely depends on Salman," he added. Talking about the film's script, Boney said, "It is 10 times funnier than 'No Entry'."

150.title: I'm fond of Smita Patil, Waheeda Rehman, Nutan: Yami Gautam
150.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam in an interview has said that she is fond of the acting of veteran actresses Smita Patil, Waheeda Rehman and Nutan. The actress was asked about which actresses' career has inspired her. Yami further said that people are unaware of the struggles of actors, adding that she might not want to go through that actress' backstory.

151.title: UP CM Yogi offers prayers at Gorakhnath temple on Maha Shivaratri
151.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath offered prayers at the Gorakhnath temple on the occasion of Maha Shivaratri on Tuesday. Pictures have also surfaced online, showing the CM performing a ritual with a group of people inside the temple. Meanwhile, devotees in the state took holy dips and offered their prayers at Magh Mela in Prayagraj early morning on Tuesday.

152.title: Hyd police trace missing purse, hand it over to college student
152.article_body: Hyderabad Police helped trace a college student's purse after she reported it missing in the city's Shamirpet area. The student took to social media to share her experience and said she was helped immediately by the force. SHO of Bollaram police station, P Sreedhar, said ASI Sudarshan Sai and PC Shiva Shanker handed over the belonging to the victim.

153.title: Every minute is precious: Rahul after Indian student killed in Ukraine
153.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said "the government needs a strategic plan for safe evacuation" after Naveen Gyanagoudar, an Indian student, was killed in shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv. "Every minute is precious," Gandhi tweeted. The Centre recently launched Operation Ganga to evacuate Indians stranded in Ukraine. India has sent four ministers to Ukraine's neighbouring countries to aid evacuation.

154.title: UP elections appear to be 'chhalia' versus Ballia: Akhilesh Yadav
154.article_body: While addressing an election meeting in the Phephana Assembly constituency, Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav said that the ongoing Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections seem to be of "chhalia" (deceit) versus Ballia. "The BJP had promised to double the income of farmers if voted to power. Farmers should say if their income has doubled? Are the farmers getting fertilisers?" Yadav added.

155.title: Thailand to deploy labour to Saudi Arabia as bilateral ties normalise
155.article_body: Thailand will facilitate deployment of labour to Saudi Arabia for the first time in decades, its government said on Tuesday. Thai cabinet approved two draft agreements on legal labour recruitment for Saudi Arabia, which will protect the rights of workers and employers, a Thai government spokesperson said. This comes as the two countries agreed to re-establish diplomatic ties in January.

156.title: Philippines ease COVID-19 restrictions amid decline in daily caseload
156.article_body: Philippines on Tuesday relaxed COVID-19 restrictions amid a decline in number of daily cases. As per the ease in norms, public transport, businesses, malls, restaurants and theatres can operate at full capacity. However, the government mandated full vaccination for all residents above 18 and wearing of masks. Meanwhile, Philippines reported 1,067 new cases and zero deaths in last 24 hours.

157.title: NLUD launches new-age digital courses on forensics, mental health
157.article_body: The National Law University, Delhi (NLUD) has launched new-age digital courses on forensics, mental health, and technology law and policy. The courses have been launched by its centres Project39A and Centre for Communication Governance (CCG). Vice-Chancellor Srikrishna Deva Rao said that NLUD's focus, since its inception, "has been to look beyond normative legal studies patterns".

158.title: Over 1 million Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccines expire in Guatemala
158.article_body: Guatemalan health authorities on Monday said over one million Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccines have expired as nobody took the doses. There was "rejection" among population towards vaccine, said Health Minister Francisco Coma. However, he added it was unclear if hesitation was over Sputnik V or all vaccines. Meanwhile, only about 43% of the eligible population in Guatemala is fully vaccinated.

159.title: 4 students from B'luru build prototype to extract biodiesel using algae
159.article_body: Four school students from Bengaluru have built a prototype to extract biodiesel using algae. The students found that algae acts as a bioreactor sequester as it can capture and store carbon dioxide and they subsequently used the bioreactor to extract the biodiesel. They discovered that algae can be sustainably farmed from freshwater bodies and double in biomass over 24 hours.

160.title: Farhan Akhtar condoles death of Indian student killed in Ukraine
160.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Farhan Akhtar on Tuesday took to Twitter to condole the death of the Indian student killed in Ukraine amid the Russian invasion. He wrote, "Feel terrible for the family...Hope we can get all our citizens home safe and soon." The Ministry of External Affairs has announced that it is in touch with the family of the student.

161.title: Kiren Rijiju leaves for Slovakia to oversee evacuation of Indians
161.article_body: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju on Tuesday boarded a SpiceJet flight for Slovakia to oversee the evacuation of Indians stranded in Ukraine. "As an envoy of PM Narendra Modi, we'll give his message to PM of Slovakia because without the help of their government we can't conduct this operation," he said. PM Modi spoke to his Slovakian counterpart on Monday.

162.title: Exploring ways to keep space station in orbit sans Russian help: NASA
162.article_body: NASA Human Spaceflight Program's Associate Administrator, Kathy Lueders, on Monday said NASA is exploring ways to keep International Space Station (ISS) in orbit without Russian help. However, she added orbiting research laboratory is yet unaffected by Russian invasion of Ukraine. This comes after Roscosmos chief hinted at pulling out of space partnership last week in response to US sanctions.

163.title: Seals in Antarctica help scientists to collect data under ice sheet
163.article_body: A group of eight Weddell seals helped Japanese researchers to survey waters and collect data such as water temperature and salt levels under thick ice sheet. Seals were equipped with 580g monitoring device on their heads that acted as a temperature and depth sensor. Project leader Nobuo Kokubun said such research helps scientists trace the animals' behavioural patterns and ecology.

164.title: Billionaire Founder of gaming company Nexon dies aged 54 in US
164.article_body: Kim Jung-ju, the billionaire Founder of Nexon, an online gaming company founded in South Korea, died at the age of 54 in United States late last month, Nexon's holding company NXC Corp said in a statement. Kim had been receiving treatment for depression and his condition seemed to have worsened recently, NXC said, without disclosing the cause of his death.

165.title: PM Modi speaks to the father of 21-yr-old Indian Medical student killed in Ukraine
165.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday spoke to the father of 21-year-old Indian Medical student Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar, who died in shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv. Meanwhile, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said, "I know his family. They are very close to me. PM had spoken to the family. We'll try our best to recover the body and bring it back to India."

166.title: West must not build military facilities in ex-Soviet nations: Russia
166.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said that the West must not build military facilities in any countries of the former Soviet Union. Russia found it unacceptable that some European countries hosted US nuclear weapons and was taking measures to prevent Ukraine from acquiring similar weapons, he added. Notably, several countries are sending weapons to Ukraine to fight the Russian forces.

167.title: Video shows diplomats walking out ahead of Russian minister's speech at UN forum
167.article_body: More than a dozen diplomats walked out ahead of a speech by Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov at the UN Human Rights Council on Tuesday in protest of its invasion of Ukraine. A video of the incident showed the diplomats walking out as soon as Lavrov's speech starts to play on the screen. Lavrov was addressing the forum remotely.

168.title: 90% Indians who study medicine abroad fail to clear exam here: Minister
168.article_body: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi on Monday said that 90% of Indian students who go abroad for medical studies fail to clear the qualifying exam in India. He added, "This isn't the right time to debate why students are moving out to study medicine." He said the government is in touch with Ukraine and Russia and will soon bring students home.

169.title: Ukrainian civilians throw Molotov cocktail at Russian tank, video surfaces
169.article_body: A video has surfaced online that showed Ukrainian civilians throwing a Molotov cocktail at a Russian tank. In the clip, their car slowly approached the tank and threw the petrol bomb, following which, flames erupted and the car moved out of the area. Earlier, Ukraine had told its residents to make Molotov cocktails to "neutralise the occupier".

170.title: UP was 'BIMARU' before, saw fastest economic growth under BJP: Rajnath
170.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said on Tuesday that the state was referred to as 'BIMARU' before but achieved fastest economic growth under BJP. "In 2017, UP's economy was at 11 lakh crore...in...last five years, it...breached 31 lakh crore-mark," he added. 'BIMARU' is an acronym for first letters of Bihar, MP, Rajasthan and UP. It also relates to 'sick' in Hindi.

171.title: Watched 2004, 2006 Pak-India series: Labuschagne ahead of Aus tour of Pak
171.article_body: Talking about his preparations for upcoming Australia tour of Pakistan, Australia batter Marnus Labuschagne said he lately watched a few old matches on YouTube, like Pakistan versus India and England series in 2004 and 2006. "Just to get a gauge on what wickets are like...they spun late and...were good for batting," he added. First Test will begin on March 4.

172.title: 'Only Ukrainians being allowed in trains', says Indian; Vir Das shares messages
172.article_body: An Indian student, trying to take a train from Kyiv-Pasazhyrsky in war-hit Ukraine, was allegedly unable to board as only Ukrainians were being allowed onboard. Her message was amplified by comedian Vir Das who sought MEA's help for the girl. Das shared messages from the girl's sibling who said, "I don't know what I can do for her...she's suffering."

173.title: Hyd may see severe heatwave, flooding in coming months: UN report
173.article_body: Hyderabad may see severe heatwave and flooding in the coming months, a report by UN's Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) predicted. Heatwaves will worsen in the Indian sub-continent and Hyderabad will be directly affected by this, the report's lead author Anjal Prakash said. Hyderabad may also see high-intensity rainfall, including heavy downpours that could flood the city, he added.

174.title: Ukraine's Prez gets standing ovation after his speech at European Parliament
174.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy received a standing ovation after his speech at the European Parliament. "Nobody's going to break us. We're strong...We're Ukrainians.
