We have a desire to see our children alive. I think it's a fair one," Zelenskyy said. "We're fighting for our land and our freedom despite the fact that all our cities are now blocked," he added.

175.title: Russian, Belarusian badminton players banned from competing until further notice
175.article_body: Badminton World Federation (BWF) announced that it is banning Russian and Belarusian badminton players from competing until further notice. Earlier, BWF cancelled all sanctioned tournaments in Russia and Belarus following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. BWF said it fully supported International Olympic Committee urging sports federations to move or cancel sports events planned in Russia or Belarus.

176.title: Instagram to shut down standalone IGTV app for longer videos
176.article_body: Instagram has announced it will no longer support its standalone IGTV app that served as Instagram's long-form video platform. "We will focus on having all videos on the main Instagram app," Instagram said. Instagram ditched its IGTV (short for Instagram TV) branding in October 2021 when it combined IGTV's long-form videos and Instagram feed videos into a new format.

177.title: He was in grocery queue, no info about his body: Hostel mate on Indian killed in Ukraine
177.article_body: After 21-year-old Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar was killed in shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv amid war with Russia, his hostel mate Sridharan Gopalakrishnan revealed Naveen had gone to buy food. "He was standing in  queue at a grocery shop when Russian army fired at people. We have no information about his body," he added. Naveen's phone was recovered by a Ukrainian woman.

178.title: I need to go back & review the situation: FM on LIC IPO amid Russia-Ukraine war
178.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, while speaking on LIC IPO amid the Russia-Ukraine war, told The Hindu BusinessLine, "Now there's a full-scale war. Therefore, I need to go back and review the situation." Sitharaman also said, "Ideally, I'd like to go ahead with it, because it is something we have planned for some time purely based on Indian considerations."

179.title: PM reviews Ukraine's situation daily to bring Indians back: Singh
179.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Tuesday said Prime Minister Narendra Modi "reviews the situation [in Ukraine] every day to bring our Indian citizens back". He added that people are facing difficulty as no airport or airstrip is left in Ukraine. "Still, we're talking to Ukrainian govt, neighbouring countries' govts to bring our citizens back," Singh added.

180.title: The label of a TV actor hurts actors working in TV shows: Urvashi
180.article_body: Actress Urvashi Dholakia said the categorisation of actors working in TV shows as TV actors hurts them, adding that it is an "awful" discrimination. "Most people taking the call of casting actors for OTT are from the TV background, but are hesitant to cast actors from TV saying we are too exposed," stated Urvashi.

181.title: 22-year-old killed by 3 friends after fight over PUBG game in Thane
181.article_body: Maharashtra Police on Tuesday arrested a 19-year-old and detained two minors for killing their 22-year-old friend after a "fight over...PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds (PUBG) game", police said. The deceased, Sayeel Jadhav, was killed on Monday in Thane's Vartak Nagar after being stabbed with a sharp weapon. They used to drink (liquor), play online games and get into constant fights, locals claimed.

182.title: Shibani drops 'Mrs Akhtar' from bio days after wedding with Farhan
182.article_body: Actress-model Shibani Dandekar on Tuesday removed 'Mrs Akhtar' from her social media bio days after getting married to actor-filmmaker Farhan Akhtar. She had added 'Mrs Akhtar' to her bio on February 23. The couple got married on February 19 in a private ceremony at Javed Akhtar and Shabana Azmi's farmhouse in Khandala. Shibani has updated her username to Shibani Dandekar-Akhtar.

183.title: My heart really goes out to Ukraine: Lady Gaga at SAG Awards 2022
183.article_body: Singer-actor Lady Gaga spoke about the Russia-Ukraine conflict at SAG Awards 2022, saying, "My heart really goes out to Ukraine. I think tonight we should all sit in the gratitude of this." She also posted a picture on Instagram, writing, "I'm praying tonight for Ukraine and am sending smiles to all your hearts I pray will be whole soon."

184.title: Pune ZP organises meetings to promote property ownership among women
184.article_body: Pune Zilla Parishad (ZP) has organised special gram sabha to mark International Women's Day this year and encourage property ownership among women. Gram panchayats in Pune district have been setting up camps to include women's names on property cards. "Property ownership is an important aspect of empowerment, [we're] working hard to facilitate [it]," Ayush Prasad, CEO of Pune ZP said.

185.title: Suspect wanted for Pak journalist's murder killed in police encounter
185.article_body: The prime suspect in the murder of Pakistani journalist Athar Mateen was killed in a police encounter in Qambar Shahdadkot on Tuesday. The incident occurred when the police conducted a raid based on a tip-off. The suspect reportedly opened fire at the police party and was subsequently killed in retaliation. Notably, two other suspects have been arrested.

186.title: Indians waive tricolour, chant Vande Mataram on return from Ukraine
186.article_body: Another batch of Indian nationals that returned from Ukraine on Tuesday chanted slogans of 'Vande Mataram' and waived the tricolour on their return at the Delhi airport. They were welcomed by Union Power Minister RK Singh at the airport. Pictures show the minister interacting with the evacuees and giving them flowers.

187.title: IPL important but you can't cherry pick when to play for Aus: Hayden
187.article_body: Reacting to players like Pat Cummins opting out of the white-ball leg of Australia's tour of Pakistan, Matthew Hayden termed the IPL as important but said players can't "cherry pick" when to play for Australia. IPL 2022 will begin on March 26. "Cricket Australia is being led around by...players. You shouldn't be paid for work you don't do," added Hayden.

188.title: Egyptian King Tut's dagger was made of material from outer space: Experts
188.article_body: A dagger buried with Egypt's teenage King Tutankhamun was made with materials that may have come from outer space, experts have said. The dagger that was first found in 1925 was crafted from iron that may have been brought to Earth by a meteorite, said a recent study published in Meteoritics and Planetary Science journal.

189.title: Manmohan Desai would drive past house, wait for her 'darshan': Nanda's brother
189.article_body: Late actress Nanda's brother Jayprakash Winayak said that late filmmaker Manmohan Desai used to "drive past [her] bungalow hoping to catch a glimpse" of the actress. "He'd even park his car outside waiting for her 'darshan'...There was...Holy Cross opposite Didi's bungalow in Bandra...Manji made it a point to shoot there for films, hoping to get sight of her," he added.

190.title: At least 10 killed in latest rocket strikes on Ukraine's Kharkiv: Official
190.article_body: At least 10 people were killed and 35 others were injured in rocket strikes by Russian forces on Ukraine's second-largest city Kharkiv on Tuesday, Ukraine's Interior Ministry adviser Anton Herashchenko said. "The rubble is being cleared and there will be even more victims and wounded," he added. Earlier, an Indian student from Karnataka was killed in shelling in Kharkiv.

191.title: Going to be a big challenge to pick between Shreyas, Suryakumar: Rohit
191.article_body: Talking about picking between Shreyas Iyer and Suryakumar Yadav, Rohit Sharma termed it as a "big" challenge. Shreyas was the top run-getter in India's T20I series against Sri Lanka, scoring 204 runs at a strike rate of 174.35. Suryakumar was India's highest run-scorer in the T20I series against West Indies with 107 runs at a strike rate of 194.54.

192.title: Parents' consent not mandatory for offline exams for Classes 10, 12 in Delhi
192.article_body: The Delhi government on Monday notified that the consent of parents for attending offline classes and giving offline exams is not mandatory for students of Classes 10 and 12. It added schools may deploy transportation facilities for students while following coronavirus-appropriate behaviour. The hybrid mode for studies for Classes up to 9 and Class 11 will continue till March 31.

193.title: Prabhas and Saif-starrer 'Adipurush' to release on Jan 12, 2023
193.article_body: Taking to Instagram, actor Prabhas announced the new release date of his film 'Adipurush'. The film, which was slated to release on August 11, will now release on January 12, 2023. Earlier, actor Aamir Khan had thanked the makers of 'Adipurush' for postponing their release date as his film 'Laal Singh Chaddha' will be releasing on August 11.

194.title: We can't stand back anymore: Benedict on Russia-Ukraine conflict
194.article_body: After being honoured at the Hollywood Walk of Fame, actor Benedict Cumberbatch expressed his support for the people of Ukraine, after Russia invaded the country. Benedict added he also supports the people in Russia who are opposing "kleptocracy and the idiocy of their rulers"."We can't stand back anymore...We need to act, and there are things you can do," he stated.

195.title: SP has hit two centuries in 5 phases of UP elections: Akhilesh
195.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Monday said his party has already hit two centuries in the first five phases of the Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections. "Our announcement to give 300 units free electricity has left the BJP clueless," Akhilesh said at a rally. "People...are fed up with BJP's lies," he added.

196.title: It will be unique if Bumrah becomes Team India captain: Irfan Pathan
196.article_body: Irfan Pathan said it will be "unique" if Jasprit Bumrah becomes Team India captain in the future, as not too many Indian bowlers have been seen in the role of a captain. "Bumrah's journey has been outstanding. He has become India's number one bowler because he plays in all the formats and bowls at difficult stages," added Irfan.

197.title: Record 21 lakh diyas to be lit up in MP's Ujjain on Mahashivratri
197.article_body: Around 21 lakh diyas will be lit up in MP's Ujjain, including 13 lakh diyas on the banks of Kshipra river, as part of Mahashivratri celebrations on Tuesday. "As many as 14,000 volunteers are participating," Ujjain Municipal Commissioner said. With this, the state government is trying to set a record of lighting the highest number of diyas, he added.

198.title: SIT report on border violence in Mon district ready: Nagaland minister
198.article_body: Nagaland minister V Kashiho Sangtam said the Special Investigation Team (SIT) has completed the investigation and is ready with its report on the border violence that took place in Mon district last year. However, it is yet to receive the forensic laboratory report, Sangtam told ANI. As many as 14 civilians were killed in the violence last year.

199.title: Thoughts go out to all suffering from needless war: Louis on cancelling show
199.article_body: Amid the ongoing Russia-Ukraine crisis, singer-songwriter Louis Tomlinson cancelled his tour shows in Moscow and Kyiv. "I have to sadly announce that my tour shows in Moscow and Kyiv are cancelled until further notice," he wrote, adding, "Safety of my fans is priority, my thoughts go out to the people of Ukraine and all those suffering from this needless war."

200.title: Prospects for diplomatic resolution to Ukraine crisis slim: UK
200.article_body: Britain's Deputy PM Dominic Raab on Tuesday said the prospects of a diplomatic resolution to the Ukraine crisis are "slim" at the moment. However, "we must always make sure that we keep the door to a diplomatic resolution open without, I think, instilling too many hopes in it", he added. Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine on February 24.

201.title: It is stupid to think about the possibility of being at war: Conte
201.article_body: Reacting to Vladimir Putin's declaration of war against Ukraine, Tottenham Hotspur manager Antonio Conte said even "thinking" about the possibility of being at "war" is stupid. "We are in 2022 and to talk about the possibility of being at war is incredible. We need peace, not people dying. The war...is not an answer to anything," stated the former Chelsea manager.

202.title: A tremendous thinker of the game: Labuschagne on Ashwin
202.article_body: Calling Ravichandran Ashwin a "tremendous thinker of the game", Australia batter Marnus Labuschagne said not all bowlers are like the India off-spinner. "He [Ashwin] is always thinking about how he can get you out. About what you are doing. And so what he's doing to counter that?" he added. The 35-year-old dismissed Labuschagne twice in Border-Gavaskar Trophy 2020-21 in Australia.

203.title: Space technology important tool for a nation: ISRO Chairman
203.article_body: ISRO Chairman, Dr S Somanath, said space technology is an important tool that a nation needs for good command on the scientific front. "Space technology and rocket science have enabled human beings to send instruments into space lasting for several years," Somanath said. He was speaking at the National Science Day celebrations organised by the Indian Institute of Astrophysics, Bengaluru.

204.title: Heat waves in Indo-Gangetic plains likely to be lower than normal: IMD
204.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) predicted that the number of heat waves in the Indo-Gangetic plains is likely to be lower than normal during March to May period. As per IMD, a "heat wave" is declared for the plains when the maximum temperature is more than 40°C. Gujarat, Sindh, Punjab, Bihar, Bengal and Assam region come under the Indo-Gangetic plains.

205.title: It's incredibly odd walking in fashion shows amid Ukraine crisis: Bella Hadid
205.article_body: Model Bella Hadid came out in support of her colleague Mica Argañaraz, who vowed to donate part of her fashion week earnings to Ukrainian organisations. Sharing her post, Bella wrote, "It's incredibly odd to be walking in fashion shows...especially during a time like this. I compel...people of our industry to...have open conversations about the hell that's happening next door."

206.title: I thought I was going to be a comedy skit blogger: Jamie Dornan
206.article_body: Actor Jamie Dornan, who played the male lead role of 'Christian Grey' in the 'Fifty Shades' film franchise, said he thought he would be a comedy skit blogger at one point. "Then I did [TV series] 'The Fall' where I play a serial killer. I used to always want to do comedy and then I just didn't," added Dornan.

207.title: 36 Kerala students stranded in Ukraine evacuated, says state govt
207.article_body: As many as 36 students hailing from Kerala, arrived from Ukraine on Monday evening, the state government said. "Kerala students update: Among 36 students arrived from Ukraine to Delhi yesterday (Monday) evening, 25 left for Kochi...11 left for Trivandrum," the Kerala government tweeted on Tuesday. These students were brought back under 'Operation Ganga'.

208.title: Sea-level rise damage in Mumbai could be $162 bn/yr by 2050: IPCC
208.article_body: The IPCC's latest report has warned that damage from sea-level rise in Mumbai alone could be up to $162 billion a year by 2050. Around 35 million people in India could face annual coastal flooding. It added that heat and humidity will globally create conditions beyond human tolerance if emissions are not rapidly eliminated, and India will experience those conditions.

209.title: Jaishankar briefs Prez Ram Nath Kovind on evacuations from Ukraine
209.article_body: The Rashtrapati Bhavan on Tuesday said that External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Monday briefed President Ram Nath Kovind about the ongoing evacuation of Indian nationals from Ukraine which is under attack from Russia. "Later the President called PM Narendra Modi and lauded the government's efforts," it added. The Centre launched 'Operation Ganga' to bring back Indians stranded in Ukraine.

210.title: Key maker allegedly steals jewellery worth ₹30 lakh from Gurugram house
210.article_body: A key maker allegedly stole jewellery worth ₹30 lakh from the house of a retired central government employee in Gurugram on Friday, police said. The incident reportedly occurred when the victim had called the key maker to get an almirah lock repaired at his house. Meanwhile, police have started an investigation into the matter and trying to arrest the accused.

211.title: He was so proud of it: 'Pavitra Rishta' director on Sushant's 'Sonchiriya'
211.article_body: 'Pavitra Rishta' director Kushal Zaveri took to Instagram to share a post about Sushant Singh Rajput starrer 'Sonchiriya' completing three years. "3rd anniversary of #sonchiriya...He was so proud of this film...Please watch it if you haven't," Kushal wrote. Fans took to comment section to show love for film. "Loved this film," one user wrote. "Forever in my heart," wrote another.

212.title: 5 booked for clicking pictures inside polling booth in UP
212.article_body: UP police registered an FIR against five persons for taking pictures and videos inside a polling booth in Sultanpur. The police identified the accused after they posted videos of them casting votes on social media. According to Sultanpur SP Vipin Mishra, they secretly carried their phones inside the booth, which is against the rules.

213.title: 21 kg ganja worth ₹7 lakh seized in Bengaluru, two arrested
213.article_body: The police have arrested two drug peddlers and recovered over 21 kg ganja worth ₹7 lakh from their possession in Bengaluru. The accused have been identified as Prakash (29) and Sundarapandi (25), both residents of Hosur in Tamil Nadu. The accused had purchased the contraband from Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, and were planning to sell it in Bengaluru.

214.title: BMRCL seeks transfer of land ownership to build Kempapura station
214.article_body: The Bengaluru Metro Rail Corporation (BMRCL) has sought the transfer of ownership of land falling under the Nagawara lake from the state government. The land will be used to build the airport line's Kempapura cross station. "Karnataka Tank Conservation and Development Authority has issued an NOC to BMRCL to use the land," said BMRCL Managing Director Anjum Parwez.

215.title: Man threatens wife with her obscene pictures in Tamil Nadu, arrested
215.article_body: A 32-year-old man was arrested in Tamil Nadu after he threatened his 27-year-old wife with her obscene pictures. He also demanded a new house as dowry. The couple had got married in October 2020. The man had reportedly told the woman that she had pimples on her face and he does not wish to spend his life with her.

216.title: Man killed by brother and nephew for selling bull in Nagpur
216.article_body: A 32-year-old man was allegedly killed by his elder brother and nephew for selling a bull without informing them in Bhagebori village of Maharashtra's Nagpur district. The two accused, Hansraj Dekate, 58, and his son Pranay, 24, attacked the victim with a rod and then smashed his head with a stone, police said. They were arrested under charges of murder.

217.title: Minister Hardeep Puri en route to Budapest to aid evacuation of Indians
217.article_body: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri is en route to Budapest in Hungary on an Indigo flight to aid the evacuation of Indian citizens stranded in war-hit Ukraine. "All set to bring back our young students back home safely," Puri tweeted. "En route to Budapest with a refuelling stop in Istanbul with the ever efficient 6E boys and girls," he added.

218.title: Court officer stabs judicial magistrate over repeated transfers in TN
218.article_body: An office assistant of court in Tamil Nadu's Salem, Prakash, allegedly stabbed Judicial Magistrate IV M Ponpandi on Tuesday after an argument over his repeated transfers. "Around 10:30 am, Prakash allegedly took out a pen-like sharp object he was hiding...and attacked the judicial magistrate," police said. Ponpandi suffered injuries on the chest and shoulder. Prakash has been arrested.

219.title: I consider actor Raza Murad as my lucky mascot: Sanjay Leela Bhansali
219.article_body: Director Sanjay Leela Bhansali termed actor Raza Murad as his "lucky mascot", adding that Murad had to be a part of his film and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' at any cost. "He has been in my last three films and they were...successes. There was no full-fledged role...this time, so I...asked him to be part of a party sequence," stated Bhansali.

220.title: Europe's joint Mars mission with Russia postponed due to war: ESA
220.article_body: The ExoMars 2022 rover, a joint mission between the European and Russian space agency that was expected to launch this year is now "very unlikely" to take place due to sanctions linked to the war in Ukraine. "We are fully implementing sanctions imposed on Russia by our Member States," the European Space Agency said in a statement.

221.title: Today LPG, tomorrow petrol & diesel: Rahul Gandhi criticises LPG price hike
221.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday criticised the hike in the price of LPG cylinders. "By increasing the prices of LPG, PM Modi-led government made it clear that it is not concerned about the suffering of common people. Today LPG, tomorrow petrol and diesel," Gandhi tweeted. The price of 19 kg commercial LPG cylinders has increased by ₹105 in Delhi.

222.title: 25-yr-old woman found hanging at marital home in UP, probe underway
222.article_body: A 25-year-old woman was found hanging at her marital home in the Banda district of Uttar Pradesh, reports said. According to reports, the husband of the deceased, Amit Gupta, found the house locked from inside on Monday and informed the police when it was not opened despite repeated knocks. Police said a case of suicide has been registered.

223.title: Gurugram likely to receive light rainfall on Thursday: IMD
223.article_body: Gurugram is likely to receive light rain and thundershowers on Thursday, because of the impact of a western disturbance, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said on Monday. According to IMD's forecast, Gurugram's maximum temperature is likely to drop by one or two degrees, while the minimum temperature is likely to rise by at least three degrees.

224.title: Bobby reacts to viral memes featuring him, says 'Keep hilarious stuff coming'
224.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol reacted to viral memes featuring him in a new video, as part of his film Love Hostel's promotions. The video begins with a still of Bobby, in which he seems to be using an airpod. Reacting to it, Bobby said, "I've always been ahead of time." Alongside the video, Bobby wrote, "Keep such hilarious stuff coming."

225.title: BSP candidates decided in Amit Shah's room: SBSP's Rajbhar
225.article_body: Alleging BSP supremo Mayawati of helping BJP win in the Uttar Pradesh Assembly election, SBSP chief Om Prakash Rajbhar said, the BSP candidates are being finalised in Amit Shah's room. Earlier, Amit Shah had said that BSP is still relevant and will get Jatav and Muslim votes. The SBSP is contesting in 18 Assembly seats in alliance with the SP.

226.title: Equation we had with journalists was better than what boys have today: Shastri
226.article_body: Former Team India head coach Ravi Shastri has said that the equation of cricketers with journalists has changed since the time he used to play. "The equation we had with the journalists was far far better than the equation you see with the boys today," he stated. Recently, wicketkeeper-batter Wriddhiman Saha received threatening WhatsApp messages from a journalist.

227.title: Amazon India elevates Amit Agarwal to head emerging markets
227.article_body: Amazon India's country head Amit Agarwal has been appointed as the Senior Vice President India and Emerging Markets at Amazon. Manish Tiwary, vice-president of the consumer business, will be the country manager for consumer business in India. Tiwary will also be responsible for Amazon Business, its business-to-business (B2B) e-commerce platform which sells goods to small and medium enterprises.

228.title: Police arrest 2 gangsters after cross-firing in Outer Delhi's Alipur
228.article_body: Delhi Police arrested two gangsters, aged 31 and 22, after 22 rounds of bullets were fired by both parties in Outer Delhi's Alipur. A woman sub-inspector received two bullets on her bullet-proof jacket, police said. "The gangsters were planning to kill a Delhi police official and Tillu Tajpuria, a rival gangster who is in jail," police added.

229.title: Dancer drugged, raped by contractor and his 10 aides in UP
229.article_body: A professional dancer in Uttar Pradesh's Bithoor was allegedly drugged and gang-raped by a contractor and his ten aides. The woman claimed the accused invited her to perform at a farmhouse and offered her cold drink laced with sedatives. After drinking it she became unconscious and was raped by him and his aides who also filmed the act, she alleged.

230.title: BBMP bans sale of meat across Bengaluru on Maha Shivaratri
230.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has ordered a complete ban on the sale of meat across Bengaluru on the occasion of Maha Shivaratri on Tuesday. The BBMP's animal advisory division had issued a circular to this effect on February 22. The circular also extends to the ban of animal slaughter in the city.

231.title: Man's partially burnt body found in Mumbai's Antop Hill area
231.article_body: The partially burnt body of a 29-year-old man was found in Mumbai's Antop Hill area on Monday, police said. The deceased, identified as Abdul Salam Munawar Ali Sayyed, succumbed to a head injury and was burnt by the accused likely to destroy evidence, the post-mortem report suggested. The body was first spotted by a resident, who then informed the police.

232.title: Domestic helps drug house owner's daughter in Gurugram, steal jewellery
232.article_body: Three house helps, including two maids and a former cook, allegedly drugged the house owner's daughter and stole jewellery and other valuables worth ₹15 lakh in Gurugram on Friday, police said. The girl's parents had reportedly gone to Mumbai when the incident occurred. Police said the crime seems to be well planned, adding that they're trying to trace the accused.

233.title: Author Stephen King shares rare pic in support of Ukraine, country responds
233.article_body: American author Stephen King shared a photo of himself wearing a t-shirt that said 'I stand with Ukraine' and wrote, "I don't usually post pictures of myself, but today is an exception." Meanwhile, Ukraine responded, "We'll prevail over those langoliers for you, sir." King had also tweeted, "For the first time in a long and infamous career, Putin looks stupid."

234.title: K'taka CM speaks with father of Indian student killed in Ukraine
234.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj S Bommai on Tuesday spoke with the father of 21-year-old Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar, a medical student who was killed in shelling in Ukraine. Naveen was a resident of the Haveri district. "All efforts will be made to bring back Naveen's body to India," his office said, adding that this matter is being negotiated with foreign ministry officials.

235.title: Newly wed Indo-Ukrainian couple who escaped war by 1 day host reception in Hyd
235.article_body: Hyderabad resident Prateek who returned from Ukraine along with his newly wed Ukrainian wife Lyubov a day before Russian invasion of Ukraine last week hosted his wedding reception in Hyderabad. Pictures of their wedding ceremony are being widely shared online. Several Indians are being evacuated from Ukraine through border nations after the Ukrainian airspace was closed amid war.

236.title: Tigress found dead in Kaziranga National Park in Assam; poisoning suspected
236.article_body: Forest authorities in Assam's Kaziranga National Park and Tiger Reserve have found the carcass of a tigress. "The carcass of the tigress was found near the carcass of a cow. Initial investigations reveal the tigress could've died after consuming the meat of the cow, which could've been poisoned," Kaziranga DFO said. A case of poaching by poisoning has been registered.

237.title: CBFC removes words like f*cking, assh*les at 12 places in 'The Batman'
237.article_body: The Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) has muted cuss words like 'f*cking', 'assh*les' and 'son of a b*tch' at 12 places from the dialogues of upcoming film 'The Batman'. These muted cuss words have also been removed from the film's subtitles. The Robert Pattinson-starrer has been passed by the CBFC with a U/A certificate after the modifications.

238.title: Kim Kardashian lookalike posts selfie with Kanye, sparks dating rumours
238.article_body: Instagram model Chaney Jones took to Instagram Stories to share a selfie with rapper Kanye West sparking dating rumours. The model has gained popularity for being a lookalike of Kanye's former wife television personality Kim Kardashian. Kim filed for divorce last year in February and is currently dating Pete Davidson. Kanye and Chaney were spotted together in Miami last week.

239.title: Poland PM to discuss Ukraine's EU candidacy with EU chief: Official
239.article_body: Poland's PM Mateusz Morawiecki will discuss support for Ukraine joining European Union (EU) with European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen in Brussels, a Polish government spokesperson said. Poland and Lithuania had previously endorsed Ukraine's membership to bloc citing "security challenges". On Monday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy signed an application for Ukraine to join the EU.

240.title: Latest rankings for women's ODI batters out, Mandhana rises to 8th spot
240.article_body: The ICC today released the latest rankings for Women ODI batters, with India captain Mithali Raj holding onto her second spot and Smriti Mandhana rising four spots to be ranked eighth. Batter Harmanpreet Kaur gained three spots to be ranked 20th while Deepti Sharma dropped two spots to the 21st position. New Zealand's Amy Satterthwaite slipped to the seventh position.

241.title: DTCP issues notices over illegal structures along Sohna-Gurugram road
241.article_body: The Department of Town and Country Planning (DTCP) on Monday issued notices to 15 people for illegally constructing shops and other structures along Sohna-Gurugram Highway, officials said. "The owners have been asked to reply to the matter within the next 15 days," a senior official said. "It's important that illegal constructions...are stopped...in the initial stage itself," the official added.

242.title: Rajkot Police Commissioner transferred amid corruption allegations
242.article_body: Rajkot Police Commissioner Manoj Agrawal was on Monday transferred and appointed as the principal of the State Reserve Police Training Centre in Junagadh. On February 2, Rajkot South MLA Govind Patel, had written to Gujarat Minister of State for Home, Harsh Sanghavi, alleging that Agrawal was demanding a cut of 15% from the money restored to victims of financial fraud.

243.title: Share info on locals stranded in Ukraine: GB Nagar admin to residents
243.article_body: Gautam Buddha Nagar administration on Monday has urged residents to inform it of locals who are stranded in Ukraine amid a Russian invasion. The information has been sought as part of the Centre's Operation Ganga, an initiative to bring back Indians stranded in Ukraine, the administration said. "The information can be provided at tehsil-level," it added.

244.title: Russian billionaires lose combined $83 billion wealth in 2 months
244.article_body: The combined wealth of Russia's 22 richest individuals has plunged by $83 billion since January 2022, as per Bloomberg. The wipeout comes amid extreme market declines following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Lukoil Chairman Vagit Alekperov has lost the most among Russian billionaires with his net worth declining by $13 billion. Meanwhile, Gennady Timchenko has lost almost half of his wealth.

245.title: Sanctions will cause collapse of Russian economy: France
245.article_body: France said sanctions against Moscow over its invasion of Ukraine will cause the Russian economy to collapse. "The economic and financial balance of power is...in favour of...European Union which is in the process of discovering its own economic power," Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire added. This comes a day after EU and France said they'd impose new sanctions on Russia.

246.title: Weibo removes 4,000 posts ridiculing war, offending Ukrainian women
246.article_body: China's social media platform Weibo has removed over 4,000 posts that "ridiculed war" and mocked the situation in Ukraine. The posts also included inappropriate and vulgar remarks related to Ukrainian women. Earlier, jokes about taking in Ukrainian women reportedly began circulating, with the hashtag "willing to shelter 18 to 24-year-old Ukrainian girls" trending on Weibo before it was censored.

247.title: Huge honour to take over this spot: Medvedev on becoming world no. 1
247.article_body: US Open champion Daniil Medvedev said it's a "huge honour" for him to become the new world number one. The Russian is first player outside 'Big Four' of Novak Djokovic, Roger Federer, Rafael Nadal and Andy Murray to hold top spot. "I'm sure everyone can understand it comes with mixed emotions that it happens this week [Russia-Ukraine conflict]," he added.

248.title: 1.80 lakh devotees take holy dip in Ganga in Prayagraj on Shivratri
248.article_body: Over 1.80 lakh devotees took a holy dip in the Ganga river in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj till Tuesday afternoon on Mahashivratri. The Prayagraj administration has arranged six ghats for devotees to take bath. Also, around 650 toilets have been arranged in the 'Magh mela' area, an official said, adding that three first aid centres and a hospital are also operational.

249.title: Opening with Shikhar Dhawan would be fantastic: PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal
249.article_body: PBKS' newly-appointed captain Mayank Agarwal has said he's excited to open their batting along with Shikhar Dhawan. "There are a lot of players in the Punjab team I am really excited about...Opening with Shikhar would be fantastic...We have picked all-rounder Raj Bawa [also]...I am looking forward to playing with him," he added. PBKS bought Dhawan for ₹8.25 crore.

250.title: PMC to set up e-vehicle charging stations at its premises
250.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has decided to set up e-vehicle charging systems at various PMC-owned premises. "Many [Pune] residents are procuring e-vehicles. To facilitate them and promote these vehicles, the PMC has approved erecting charging stations at its main building and all the regional ward offices," Standing Committee Chairperson Hemant Rasane said.

251.title: 2 hand grenades found in locked home in Gurugram, neutralised: Police
251.article_body: Gurugram Police Commissioner Kala Ramachandran confirmed on Tuesday that two hand grenades and used cartridges were found in a locked and vacant house in Gurugram Sector 31. The police had received a tip-off around 9:45 am. "We are yet to find out where these grenades were transported from and how they ended up in the house," police said.

252.title: Video shows Ukrainian children singing national anthem while hiding in bomb shelter
252.article_body: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine has shared a video where children could be seen singing the national anthem while hiding in a bomb shelter. The Ukrainian anthem originates from a 19th-century Ukrainian poem titled 'Ukraine Is Not Dead Yet'. Several such videos of citizens singing the anthem amid the Russian invasion have also surfaced on social media.

253.title: Reality shows other than Smart Jodi are couple breakers: Rahul Mahajan
253.article_body: TV personality Rahul Mahajan said that reality shows barring the new reality show Smart Jodi are "couple breakers", adding that he and his wife Natalya Ilina Mahajan "really like" actress Ankita Lokhande and her husband Vicky Jain. "There could be fights between them or can cause other problems too. You have to be real," stated Rahul.

254.title: Visa, Mastercard block Russian financial institutions over Ukraine invasion
254.article_body: Global payment card majors Visa and Mastercard have blocked many of Russia's financial institutions from their network in compliance with the sanctions imposed by the US government over Ukraine invasion. "We will continue to work with regulators in the days ahead," said Mastercard. Both companies also promised to donate $2 million each for humanitarian aid in Ukraine.

255.title: Won't allow state Budget session until Malik resigns: Maha BJP
255.article_body: The Maharashtra BJP said that it will not allow the state Budget session to be held until NCP's Nawab Malik resigns from the cabinet. "The BJP has asked the MVA government to seek Malik's resignation for his alleged links and land deals with underworld don Dawood Ibrahim and the 1993 serial bomb blast convicts," BJP Maharashtra chief Chandrakant Patil said.

256.title: Volopay, founded by 2 Indians, raises $29 mn from Winklevoss twins, others
256.article_body: Singapore-based fintech startup Volopay has raised $29 million in Series A, a mix of equity and debt, from Tyler and Cameron Winklevoss' venture capital firm Winklevoss Capital and JAM Fund, among others. The round also saw participation from Pine Labs CEO Amrish Rau and Jupiter CEO Jitendra Gupta. Volopay was founded by two Indians, Rajesh Raikwar and Rajith Shaji.

257.title: 28-year-old woman, 6-year-old daughter found dead in a well in Pune
257.article_body: A 28-year-old woman and her six-year-old daughter, who had gone missing since February 26 in Pune, were found in a well in Ganegaon Khalsa village, police said. The woman left with her daughter on Saturday, saying she was taking her to the coaching class, police added. The husband filed a missing report when the two didn't return home till late.

258.title: Future Retail gets NCLT nod to convene meetings to approve RIL deal
258.article_body: The National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) has allowed Future Retail to convene meetings of its shareholders and creditors to seek their approval for the sale of its retail assets to Reliance Retail. The companies had announced the ₹24,713 crore deal in 2020. Notably, Reliance has started taking over the operations of Future Retail stores, as per reports last week.

259.title: Indian student who died in shelling in Ukraine was 21 years old, hailed from Karnataka
259.article_body: The Indian student who lost his life in shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv has been identified as 21-year-old Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar. He was a fourth year MBBS student at Kharkiv National Medical University and hailed from Haveri district in Karnataka. As per reports, he was standing in a queue at a supermarket in Kharkiv when Russian shelling happened.

260.title: Hacker group Anonymous renames Putin's $100 million yacht as 'FCKPTN'
260.article_body: The world's largest hacker collective Anonymous said it has changed the name of Russian President Vladimir Putin's $100 million luxury yacht from 'Graceful' to 'FCKPTN', amid Ukraine's invasion. The group vandalised maritime tracking data and changed the yacht's location information to make it appear that it crashed into Ukraine's Snake Island. The hackers then renamed its destination to 'hell'.

261.title: If I start speaking, Sequoia won't be able to invest in India: BharatPe's Ashneer
261.article_body: BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover, who resigned as MD, in an interview, criticised board chairman Rajnish Kumar, CEO Suhail Sameer and other independent directors and investors, saying, "I have so much dirt on them." "Tomorrow if I start speaking, Sequoia (Capital) will not be able to make a single investment in India. You will have ED, CBI behind them," he claimed.

262.title: Priyanka, Nick perform first Maha Shivratri puja after becoming parents
262.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra and her husband, Nick Jonas on Tuesday celebrated their first Maha Shivratri after becoming parents. Taking to Instagram Stories, Priyanka shared pictures as they performed pooja at their home in Los Angeles. In the picture, Priyanka wore a pink outfit. Sharing the post, Priyanka wrote in Hindi, "Maha Shivratri ki hardik shubhkamnaye. (Best wishes on Maha Shivratri)."

263.title: Manipur to get new AIIMS, announces PM Modi in virtual address
263.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday announced construction of a new AIIMS in Manipur. "We are planning to build an AIIMS in Manipur. This is the time of Atmanirbhar Bharat," said Modi addressing a virtual rally ahead of the second phase of assembly polls in the state. It would be the 24th AIIMS to come up in the country.

264.title: MP govt to arrange for food, stay of students returning from Ukraine
264.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh government has directed officials to make arrangements for accommodation, food and transportation of students returning from Ukraine. Over 180 students stuck in Ukraine have contacted a helpline set up by the Madhya Pradesh CM, an official said. As many as 29 people from the state have returned from Ukraine.

265.title: Jet fuel prices touch highest ever after 3.3% hike, fifth hike in 2022
265.article_body: Prices of Jet fuel, or Aviation Turbine Fuel (ATF), touched their all-time high after a 3.22% rise due to rising crude oil prices. ATF price was hiked by ₹3,010.87/kilolitre to ₹93,530.66/kl in Delhi. This is the fifth time that prices of ATF, which makes up for almost 40% of an airline's running cost, have been hiked in 2022.

266.title: Taiwan sends medical supplies to Ukraine amid Russian invasion
266.article_body: Taiwan has sent 27 tonnes of medical supplies to Ukraine, its government announced on Tuesday, stating that it's extending a helping hand as member of "democratic camp" in international community. These supplies were sent to Germany and will be delivered to Ukraine from there. Additionally, Taiwan will also block certain Russian banks from SWIFT payment system, Premier Su Tseng-chang said.

267.title: Not sure what it means, we're the dictionary: Dictionary.com on US politician's tweet
267.article_body: Dictionary.com trolled US lawmaker Clay Higgins over his tweet on the Russia-Ukraine war by responding, "We're not sure what this tweet is supposed to mean, and we're literally the dictionary." Higgins had called out "millennial leftists who never lived one day under nuclear threat" to reflect upon their "woke sky". Musician Jonathan Mann turned Higgins' tweet into a song.

268.title: Cameras were switched off by investors during board meeting: BharatPe's Ashneer
268.article_body: BharatPe's Co-founder Ashneer Grover, who resigned as BharatPe's MD and board director, claimed cameras were switched off by the investors during a board meeting. He said, "Because, at that particular time, that investor is giving WhatsApp instructions to everyone in the meeting on how to vote." Grover added, "I'll take this up to the Minister of Corporate Affairs."

269.title: Visa, Mastercard block Russian financial institutions after sanctions
269.article_body: Visa and Mastercard have blocked multiple Russian financial institutions, including the Russian central bank, from their network after the US imposed sanctions over Russian invasion of Ukraine. "We'll continue to work with regulators...to abide fully by our compliance obligations as they evolve," Mastercard said. Visa and Mastercard also promised to contribute $2 million each for humanitarian aid.

270.title: UP man strangles wife with saree for chatting on phone for long hours
270.article_body: A man allegedly strangled his wife with a saree and later surrendered at the local police station in Uttar Pradesh's Unnao. The man told police that he killed his wife as he was upset over her prolonged use of mobile phone. "His wife used to chat on the mobile phone with someone for long hours," a senior police officer said.

271.title: Ukraine is victim of crises created by US: Iran Supreme Leader
271.article_body: Iran's Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei said Ukraine is a "victim of the crises concocted by the US". "There are two lessons to be learnt here. States which depend on the support of...US, Western powers need to know they cannot trust such countries. It's people that matter; if Ukrainians supported their government, the situation would've been different from...current crisis," he added.

272.title: Man stabs brother to death for fighting with his friend in Mumbai, held
272.article_body: A 30-year-old man, Ashok, stabbed his brother Akash to death in Mumbai after Akash fought with Ashok's friend. The incident took place in Lal Baug's Chivda Galli. Kalachowki Police have arrested Ashok in the case. A case has also been registered against him under Section 302 (Punishment for murder) of the Indian Penal Code (IPC).

273.title: I sleep for 3 hours some days, it's not easy at all: Nishant on TV career
273.article_body: Television actor Nishant Malkhani, while talking about his work, said that "it is not easy at all". "It is very tough and hectic...I sleep for three hours at night on some days...It is physically tiring but very satisfying emotionally. As an actor, you want to be busy...dabble with different kinds of roles...No one likes to sit at home," he added.

274.title: GST revenues rise 18% in Feb to cross ₹1.3 lakh cr mark for 5th time
274.article_body: Gross revenue collection from GST surged 18% YoY to ₹1,33,026 crore in February 2022, government data showed. This is the fifth time GST collection crossed the ₹1.3 lakh crore mark. Revenues collected in February 2022 are 26% higher than those collected in February 2020. Of the total revenue, central GST is ₹24,435 crore and state GST is ₹30,779 crore.

275.title: Malik approaches Bombay HC seeking quashing of money laundering case
275.article_body: Maharashtra minister and NCP leader Nawab Malik has approached Bombay High Court seeking to quash a money laundering case registered by Enforcement Directorate against him. He said his arrest was illegal and asked the court to release him immediately. He was arrested in connection to an alleged money laundering case linked to underworld don Dawood Ibrahim and his aides.

276.title: YouTube blocks Russian state-run media Sputnik & RT across Europe
276.article_body: Google on Tuesday announced that it is blocking the YouTube channels connected to Russian state-run media companies RT and Sputnik across Europe with immediate effect due to the ongoing war in Ukraine. "It'll take time for our systems to fully ramp up. Our teams continue to monitor the situation around the clock to take swift action," the tech giant said.

277.title: B'luru traffic to be affected amid Mekedatu rally; police issues advisory
277.article_body: Bengaluru Traffic Police has issued an advisory for commuters as the traffic in the city is expected to be affected till March 3 amid the Congress' Mekedatu rally. Traffic from the Tavarekere junction to BTM Layout 1st stage has been diverted from Dairy Circle to Jayadeva junction. People going from Mysuru-Bengaluru have been advised to go through the NICE Bridge.

278.title: Foundation stones laid for 26 NH projects worth ₹12,795 cr in K'taka
278.article_body: Union Minister of Road Transport and Highways Nitin Gadkari on Monday laid the foundation stones for 26 National Highway projects spread across 925 kilometres worth ₹12,795 crore in Karnataka's Hubballi. "They will provide connectivity to heritage monuments in Karnataka which will boost the tourism sector and create sustainable employment opportunities in the state," Gadkari tweeted.

279.title: Pic shows blood-stained mother clutching child's scarf as medics fail to save her in Ukraine
279.article_body: A picture showing a blood-stained mother crying while clutching her daughter's scarf as paramedics fail to save her in Ukraine is being widely shared online. The girl was fatally wounded in the Russian airstrike, according to reports. The picture shows paramedics performing CPR on the girl as her mother stood outside.

280.title: Asked him for a few minutes, we ended up talking for 4 hours: Jemimah on Kohli
280.article_body: India Women batter Jemimah Rodrigues narrated how she and fellow batter Smriti Mandhana met Virat Kohli at a hotel cafe in New Zealand. "We had asked him for just a few minutes but we ended up speaking for four hours. We spoke half an hour about batting but after that, it was just normal things," she added.

281.title: Shouldn't be much of an issue: Gavaskar on Rohit's 1st Test as skipper
281.article_body: Ex-India skipper Sunil Gavaskar said Rohit Sharma captaining Team India for the first time in a Test against Sri Lanka shouldn't be an issue because of his experience of captaining various teams. "Yes, this is...longer format, so the tactics...the approach will be different. But he has got the experience," he added. First India-Sri Lanka Test will begin on March 4.

282.title: Indian student killed in shelling in war in Ukraine
282.article_body: An Indian student has lost his life in shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv, the Centre confirmed on Tuesday. Some reports quoted his friends as saying that they had left for the train station to leave for Ukrainian city of Lviv to reach the western border. This comes as Indian Embassy in Ukraine asked Indians to leave Kyiv urgently amid Russian invasion.

283.title: Several injured in cylinder blast at maternity hospital in J&K's Anantnag
283.article_body: Several people were injured in a cylinder blast at Maternity and Child Care Hospital (MCCH) in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag on Tuesday. According to a hospital official, the explosion took place due to a leakage in a heating gas cylinder at the ticket counter. He added that the injured persons have been shifted to Anantnag's Government Medical College for treatment.

284.title: Congress didn't work for Manipur's development, encouraged separatism: PM
284.article_body: Congress party did not work for the development of Manipur and encouraged separatism, PM Narendra Modi said. "The people of Manipur have to be aware of this. BJP works for the development of the Northeast, especially Manipur," PM Modi added. "This is destroying their plans of divide and rule," PM Modi stated.

285.title: Nadal's will unquestionably be the GOAT if he wins French Open 2022: Kyrgios
285.article_body: Nick Kyrgios said Rafael Nadal will unquestionably the "GOAT (Greatest of All Time)" if he wins French Open 2022, adding that Daniil Medvedev is the best player currently despite Nadal winning the Australian Open 2022 final. Medvedev and Nadal competed in the final, with a triumph resulting in the Spaniard winning a record-breaking 21st Grand Slam title.

286.title: Mumbai Metro Line 1 achieves ridership of 70 cr commuters in 7 years
286.article_body: The Mumbai Metro Line 1 achieved a ridership of 70 crore commuters within seven years and two months of operational days, said officials. This achievement has been the outcome of "world-class service" and "flawless operational excellence", said an official. Inaugurated in 2014, Metro Line 1 added one million commuters from 20th October 2019 to 28th February 2022.

287.title: Delhi zoo reopens after 2 months, all 4,000 tickets sold overnight
287.article_body: Delhi zoo reopened for the public on Tuesday after remaining closed for nearly two months due to surge in COVID-19 cases. All 4,000 tickets were sold by 8:30 am after the link to book tickets was reactivated on Monday night. Only 4,000 people are allowed in the zoo from 8:30 am to 12:30 pm and 12:30 pm to 4:30 pm.

288.title: 2 men sexually assault 16-yr-old boy in Gurugram, booked
288.article_body: Two men have been booked for allegedly sexually assaulting a 16-year-old boy working as a domestic help at their house in Gurugram Sector-56, police said. According to a senior police officer, the house owner first assaulted the boy in an inebriated condition. However, when the boy approached the owner's friend for help, the latter too sodomised him, the officer added.

289.title: Woman stitches gold beads worth ₹18 lakh in burqa, caught at Hyd airport
289.article_body: Customs officers at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport booked a woman passenger for smuggling 350.00 grams of gold worth ₹18.18 lakh. According to the officials, she had concealed the gold in the form of beads, coated with rhodium, that were stitched on burqas. Meanwhile, a case has been registered against the woman, who had arrived from Dubai on February 26.

290.title: 3.5 lakh Ukrainians have entered Poland since war began: Min
290.article_body: Polish Deputy Interior Minister Maciej Wasik said that 1,00,000 people have crossed the Polish-Ukrainian border in the last 24 hours. Around 3,50,000 people have entered Poland from Ukraine since Russia invaded the country on Thursday, Wasik told public broadcaster Polskie Radio 1. According to the UN refugee agency, more than five lakh people have fled Ukraine since Thursday.

291.title: Visva-Bharati students hold protests, demand reopening of hostels
291.article_body: A section of students at West Bengal's Visva-Bharati University has been protesting at the Registrar's office since Monday demanding reopening of hostels, holding of exams online and postponing of board exams. According to a protesting student, physical classes had resumed on February 3, however, hostels remain closed. "Students are facing challenges in attending their classes," the student added.

292.title: Man kills younger brother over fight with friend in Mumbai
292.article_body: A 30-year-old man was arrested by Mumbai Police for allegedly killing his younger brother in the Kalachowki area. "(The accused) Ashok...killed (his brother) Akash with a knife after the latter fought with the accused's friend," Mumbai Police said on Tuesday. Ashok has been booked under IPC Section 302, police added. The siblings are residents of GD Ambekar Marg.

293.title: Alcohol consumers who help expose smugglers may avoid jail in Bihar
293.article_body: Bihar government is planning to grant relief from jail to tipplers if they cooperate with authorities in identifying liquor smugglers. The move comes as part of the government's crackdown on liquor traders and to decongest the jails. "We need to stop overcrowding jails and give legal relief to those who cooperate with us in tracking liquor traders," said an official.

294.title: President Ram Nath Kovind inaugurates 'Arogya Vanam' at Rashtrapati Bhavan
294.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind on Tuesday inaugurated 'Arogya Vanam' in presence of PM Narendra Modi, to publicise the importance of Ayurvedic plants and their benefits. Spread across 6.6 acres at the Rashtrapati Bhavan, the Arogya Vanam has been developed in the shape of a human sitting in Yoga Mudra. It consists of around 215 herbs used in Ayurveda.

295.title: Women don't get to play action-based roles, we don't get the budget: Huma
295.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi said she is very keen on doing action films. "I enjoy doing action-based films," she added. Huma said that women don't get many opportunities to play action-based roles. "We don't get such scripts and neither the budget...If we do get such roles, then I'm sure we women are nowhere lesser than males," she added.

296.title: When there's a bit of extra pace, it's kryptonite for Shreyas Iyer: Hogg
296.article_body: Ex-Australia cricketer Brad Hogg has said that India batter Shreyas Iyer is not comfortable against quicker deliveries. Hogg added, "When there's a little bit of extra pace, it's still a little kryptonite for Iyer...he tries to move around to put the bowler off." He further said, "We'll just see how he develops his game in the Tests [against Sri Lanka]."

297.title: Ukraine releases list of army losses suffered by Russia, says 5,700 Russian soldiers killed
297.article_body: Ukraine on Tuesday released the list of army losses suffered by Russia, with its Defence Minister saying, "It's only indicative estimates. But it illustrates well the situation of the occupier. The enemy is demoralised, he's in agony." The list states that the Russian army lost 5,710 soldiers, 29 aircraft, 29 helicopters, 198 tanks and two warships among other things.

298.title: 'Kacha Badam' singer backs his car into a wall, receives injuries to chest & face
298.article_body: The singer of the viral song 'Kacha Badam', Bhuban Badyakar, met with an accident on Monday and received injuries to his face and chest. He was trying to back his vehicle when he rammed it into a wall in his native West Bengal. Badyakar was reportedly injured while learning to drive his recently-purchased car.

299.title: Nadella wrote about how his son Zain's cerebral palsy changed him in his book
299.article_body: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella in his book 'Hit Refresh' wrote about how his son's cerebral palsy helped him understand people of all disabilities. He wrote that visits to Zain's hospital gave him an outlook on how Microsoft technologies helped improve the medical space and that his work "transcended business". Being an empathetic father made him a "better leader", he added.

300.title: 7 women arrested for smuggling liquor in Bihar's Bhagalpur district
300.article_body: Seven women from Jharkhand were arrested for smuggling country-made liquor in Bihar’s Bhagalpur district, Senior Superintendent of Police, Babu Ram, said. The excise department was tipped-off that these women were coming to Bhagalpur on a passenger train for selling liquor in the garb of herbal items. The women were arrested at Sabaur Railway Station and 200 liquor bottles were recovered.

301.title: Sweeper steals ₹33 lakh cash at sub-post office in Hyderabad, arrested
301.article_body: The Cyberabad Police on Sunday arrested a man for allegedly stealing ₹33 lakh cash at a sub-post office in Hyderabad. The accused, who worked as a sweeper at the post office, had allegedly broken the grills to gain entry into the premises, police said. After committing the theft, he set the post office ablaze, police added.

302.title: Bomb squad starts searches over reports of explosives at Gurugram home
302.article_body: After reports of the presence of explosives and ammunition at a vacant house in Gurugram Sector 31 on Tuesday, police started a search operation. Residents of nearby houses were asked to vacate their homes. The DCP Gurugram (East) said, "The bomb disposal squad is following protocol and only after their probe is complete, we'll be able to ascertain any details."

303.title: Ukraine warns residents of mysterious 'X' symbols appearing on buildings
303.article_body: The Ukrainian authorities have warned people to check for mysterious symbols on their buildings, presumably marked as targets for Russian airstrikes. Some of these symbols include bright red X-marks and arrows that have been spotted on rooftops and gas pipes. A Ukrainian mayor has also asked residents to paint and close access to the roof if marks are found.

304.title: Russian missile strikes near Kharkiv's administration building, Ukraine govt shares video
304.article_body: A Russian missile struck near an administration building of Ukraine's second-largest city Kharkiv. Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs shared a video of the missile attack. "Russia is waging war in violation of international humanitarian law. Kills civilians, destroys civilian infrastructure. Russia's main target is large cities that are now fired at by its missiles," it wrote.

305.title: Sister would've loved it and cried: Benedict on 'Hollywood Walk of Fame' star
305.article_body: Actor Benedict Cumberbatch spoke about her sister Tracy Peacock after being honoured with Hollywood Walk of Fame star. "She would have loved this...She would have just been laughing nonstop all the way through, and probably crying," he said, adding, "I hope somewhere up there, where the real stars shine, you're looking down on this moment now. I'm sure you are."

306.title: Rohit is amazing, he connects to every individual: Shreyas
306.article_body: India batter Shreyas Iyer has praised captain Rohit Sharma, stating that the 34-year-old connects to every individual. "Rohit is amazing. He thinks from a player's point of view. He has got that mindset...I respect him a lot," Iyer added. "We have played together at the domestic level a lot...So, it's a good space to be around," he further said.

307.title: Australia facing more floods, droughts due to global warming: Scientists
307.article_body: Climate scientists warned that global warming is leading to catastrophic weather events in Australia like bushfires, floods, droughts, heatwaves and storms. This is leading to deaths, injuries, financial and emotional stress globally, they added. Many of these risks could be potentially avoided if we reduce our greenhouse gas emissions and strengthen our adaptation responses, they believe.

308.title: Video appears to show Ukraine farmer towing away Russian tank with tractor
308.article_body: A video has surfaced online that appears to show a Ukrainian farmer towing away a Russian tank with his tractor. The video was shared on Twitter by former Ukrainian Ambassador to Austria, Olexander Scherba, who wrote, "Ukrainians are tough cookies indeed." In the video, a man, believed to be a Russian soldier, runs after the vehicle.

309.title: Laser treatment mentioned in wife's termination letter was for a skin condition: Ashneer
309.article_body: BharatPe's Co-founder Ashneer Grover, who quit the company days after his wife was sacked alleging 'misappropriation of funds', called his wife's sacking "not just injustice, but male chauvinism at best." Ashneer said, "In the termination letter, they have mentioned a laser treatment." He added, "My wife had a skin condition...that bill is a private bill. She paid for it."

310.title: Telangana budget session to begin without Governor's address
310.article_body: The Telangana Assembly's budget session will not have the mandatory address by Governor this year, as per notification issued by the state government. This is the first time that the Governor won't be addressing a joint session before the budget presentation. The decision is taken due to a face-off between CM KCR and the BJP government, a TRS leader said.

311.title: Rainwater on highways to be used for power generation across K'taka: CM
311.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj S Bommai said that water flowing along the National Highways will be used for power generation across the state. The project will be implemented along the stretch from Karnataka's Kittur to Belagavi, which reaches up to the Maharashtra border, he added. "Robust development will be seen by implementing Jal Shakti project along all the highways," Bommai tweeted.

312.title: Medical student, 3 others held in TN for sexually assaulting minor over 1 month
312.article_body: Four persons, including a medical student, have been arrested in Tamil Nadu's Chennai for allegedly repeatedly sexually assaulting a 13-year-old girl over a period of one month. The accused also allegedly introduced her to drugs, police said. The 20-year-old dental student had befriended the girl through Instagram. Later, she was also sexually assaulted by the student's three associates.

313.title: Russia tells TikTok not to recommend military content to minors
313.article_body: Russia has asked TikTok not to show military-related content in recommended posts for minors. The Russian regulator Roskomnadzor said it had identified content on TikTok showing Russia's "special military operation" in Ukraine and a lot of them being anti-Russian in nature. TikTok has restricted access to Russian state media outlets RT and Sputnik across the EU.

314.title: Bitcoin briefly rises above $44,000 for the 1st time since Feb 17
314.article_body: Bitcoin, the world's largest cryptocurrency, was briefly trading above $44,000 for the first time since February 17 on Tuesday. It rose as much as 6% to $44,183 and was later trading at around $43,400. The surge came amid growing demand for cryptocurrencies following the Russian invasion of Ukraine and escalating sanctions on Russia.

315.title: Not a beggar: Ashneer on receiving any compensation after quitting BharatPe
315.article_body: BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover on Tuesday resigned from the company. When asked if he was offered any monetary compensation by the board, he responded, "I am not a beggar. The board can't even look me in the eyes. I am not at their mercy. They are at our mercy." He also said that he'll be a shareholder at the company.

316.title: Do you think I listen to anyone's advice?: Ashneer on his decision to quit BharatPe
316.article_body: Ashneer Grover, while responding to a journalist’s query if his decision to resign from BharatPe was a personal one or advised by his lawyer, said, "Do you think I listen to anyone’s advice?...God has given me my mind and I have enough courage to take decisions on my own." He added, "I am Ashneer Grover...I'm not answerable to anyone."

317.title: Maha man gets death sentence for kidnapping, raping and killing minor
317.article_body: A special fast track court in Maharashtra convicted a 38-year-old man of raping and killing a two-and-a-half-year-old girl and awarded him a death sentence. According to the public prosecutor, the convict had kidnapped the minor, raped her and strangled her to death in February 2021. As many as 11 bite marks were found on the girl's body, he added.

318.title: Sri Lanka extends visas for Russian & Ukrainian tourists amid war
318.article_body:
The Sri Lankan government has approved a proposal by the Tourism Ministry to extend the validity of visas for Russian and Ukrainian tourists in the country for two months without any additional charges. 
This comes amid the ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine. There are 11,463 Russians and 3,993 Ukrainian tourists currently in Sri Lanka, according to the Tourism Ministry.

319.title: Sand artist creates Lord Shiva sculpture with 23,000 rudraksha beads
319.article_body: On occasion of Mahashivratri, Odisha sand artist Sudarsan Pattnaik has created a sculpture of Lord Shiva with 23,436 rudraksha beads. The sculpture has been made on Puri beach. The nine-foot-high and 18-foot-wide installation was erected on Monday. "A war is going on. We pray to Lord Shiva for global peace," he said.

320.title: Mamata inaugurates Kolkata Book Fair, requests peace outside Russian stall
320.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee inaugurated the 45th International Kolkata Book Fair on Monday. In view of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Mamata urged that no one should stage a protest in front of a bookstall set up by Russia. Police have been deployed around the stall. "Protest against war, but don't protest on the book fair ground," she said.

321.title: Indian grey hornbills released in Gir forest after nearly 8 decades
321.article_body: Gujarat forest department reintroduced 20 Indian grey hornbills in the Gir forest nearly after 82 years after they vanished from the forest. Ornithologist Late R S Dharmakumarsinhji had suggested reintroducing the birds in Gir as they play a pivotal role in the forest ecosystem, sanctuary superintendent said. They were captured from northern India and released in three batches into forest.

322.title: I'm stunned by your performance: Varun praises Alia for Gangubai Kathiawadi
322.article_body: Varun Dhawan praised actress Alia Bhatt for her performance in 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'. Taking to Instagram Stories, he wrote, "I'm...so happy and stunned by your...brilliant performance and this beautiful film. Every technician, every person who worked on it deserves every bit of the accolades they're getting." Actors including Samantha Prabhu and Ranveer Singh also praised Alia's performance.

323.title: He is dangesh, not Akhilesh: MP CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan
323.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said that on one hand, PM Narendra Modi is running "Mission Ganga" to bring back the stranded Indians from Ukraine, while on the other, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav ran "Mission Danga" (riots) during his tenure as CM. "He is not Akhilesh but dangesh. More than 700 riots took place under his government," Chouhan added.

324.title: Central Railway earns ₹443.35 crore from scrap disposal
324.article_body: The Central Railway has earned ₹443.35 crore for the financial year 2021-22 up to February this year by selling scrap, officials have said. Central Railway's General Manager Anil Kumar Lahoti said the sale of scrap also helps in keeping railway premises clean. According to officials, these scrap materials include scrap rails, permanent-way materials, condemned coaches, wagons, locomotives, etc.

325.title: She was semi-conscious, said 'want to go home to protect Viku': Vikas on sister
325.article_body: Chef Vikas Khanna said his sister Radhika Khanna, who passed away on Monday, kept telling doctors she wants to go home "to protect Viku" even when she was semi-conscious. Vikas shared a video including several of his pictures with Radhika on Instagram. He also said that they were getting ready for her kidney transplant and that he was "perfect donor".

326.title: Alia Bhatt got paid ₹20 cr for 'Gangubai..', Ajay received ₹11 cr for his cameo: Reports
326.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt, who played the titular role in 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' got paid ₹20 crore for the Sanjay Leela Bhansali directorial, as per reports. Actor Ajay Devgn, who played the role of Rahim Lala as a cameo in the film, received ₹11 crore, reports added. As per Moneycontrol, the film was created on a budget of ₹100 crore.

327.title: Mandhana scores fifty as India Women defeat WI in WC warm-up match
327.article_body: Opener Smriti Mandhana smashed 66 runs off 67 balls as India Women defeated West Indies by 81 runs in their second warm-up match ahead of the ICC Women's 2022 ODI World Cup. India posted 258 with Mandhana and Deepti Sharma crossing the 50-run mark. Pooja Vastrakar then picked three wickets to help India restrict WI to 177/9 in 50 overs.

328.title: GM, Harley-Davidson halt shipments to Russia amid ongoing war
328.article_body: General Motors and Harley-Davidson have halted their shipments to Russia amid the ongoing war in Ukraine and the resultant economic sanctions. GM cited "a number of external factors, including supply chain issues and other matters beyond the company's control". Harley-Davidson relied on Europe and the Mideast for 31% of motorcycle sales last year.

329.title: Death toll in Jharkhand boat accident rises to 14 as 6 more bodies found
329.article_body: Six more bodies were recovered by the NDRF on Monday taking the death toll in Jharkhand's boat accident to 14, officials said. "The first body was recovered on Saturday, seven on Sunday and six on Monday," DC Faiz Aq Ahmed Mumtaz said. On February 24, a boat capsized in the Damodar river in Jamtara district after which several went missing.

330.title: New York man wins $10 million lottery for the 2nd time in 3 years
330.article_body: A New York man has won a $10 million lottery prize for the second time in three years. Juan Hernandez had won the same amount in 2019, lottery officials said. "I'm still trying to spend the $10 million I won in [2019]," Hernandez said, adding that he'll be donating the money from his second lottery win to people in need.

331.title: Russian President Putin stripped of honorary black belt by World Taekwondo
331.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has been stripped of his honorary black belt by World Taekwondo in response to his invasion of Ukraine. Putin was conferred the black belt in 2013. "World Taekwondo strongly condemns the brutal attacks on innocent lives in Ukraine, which go against the World Taekwondo vision of Peace is More Precious than Triumph," it tweeted.

332.title: Germany to spend €100 billion on defence amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine
332.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Sunday said that the country would sharply increase its spending on defence to €100 billion in 2022. Germany's entire defence budget by comparison was €47 billion in 2021. Germany is sending defensive anti-tank weapons, surface-to-air missiles and ammunition to Ukraine, with Scholz saying, "There could be no other answer to Putin's aggression."

333.title: After Amul, Gowardhan milk prices increased by ₹2 per litre
333.article_body: A day after Amul increased milk prices by ₹2 per litre, Parag Milk Foods has raised the price of Gowardhan brand of cow milk by ₹2 per litre with immediate effect. "This price hike is being done after almost 3 years due to rise in costs of energy, packaging, logistics and cattle feed," Chairman Devendra Shah said.

334.title: Man slaps couple for objecting to abuses on road in Guj, complaint filed
334.article_body: A man, Nitin Bhojkar, filed complaint against unknown man in Gujarat after he slapped Nitin and his wife in road rage incident. The man's car overtook Nitin's car and stopped in front of it. Nitin was forced to apply breaks, after which man stepped out and abused Nitin. He slapped Nitin and his wife when she tried to intervene.

335.title: Ilker Ayci declines offer to be new Air India CEO
335.article_body: Former Chairman of Turkish Airlines, Ilker Ayci, has rejected Tata Sons' offer to be Air India's new CEO. Ayci alleged that his appointment to the position was "coloured" by Indian media, Bloomberg reported citing an email. Earlier, RSS-affiliate Swadeshi Jagran Manch opposed the appointment of Ayci, who was Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan's advisor in 1990s, citing "national security".

336.title: UK blocks Russian ships from its ports over Ukraine invasion
336.article_body: The UK has ordered its ports to not "provide access to any Russian flagged, registered, owned, controlled, chartered, or operated vessels" in response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "The maritime sector is fundamental to international trade and we must play our part in restricting Russia's economic interests and holding...Russian government to account," UK Transport Secretary Grant Shapps said.

337.title: Twitter to label tweets having content from Russian state media
337.article_body: Twitter will be labelling and reducing the visibility for tweets containing content from Russian state-affiliated media websites like RT and Sputnik. Twitter said that since Russia invaded Ukraine last week, it had seen more than 45,000 tweets a day from people sharing these links. Earlier, Twitter had been restricted across every major Russian telecom provider amid the ongoing conflict.

338.title: Aayush suffered severe cramp during his Da-Bangg Tour performance: Reports
338.article_body: At the Dubai show of Da-Bangg Tour, actor Aayush Sharma reportedly suffered from a cramp on the stage during his performance. However, the actor still continued his act and only stopped after completing the performance. According to a source, "Aayush showed impressive levels of commitment for his performance at...Dabangg Tour...Aayush [was] in immense pain, but he still didn't stop."

339.title: Delhi's air quality in Feb this year was cleanest for the month since 2017
339.article_body: This year, Delhi has recorded the cleanest air for the month of February since 2017, as per Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) bulletins. Delhi recorded an average AQI of 224 throughout February, cleaner than the previous low of 241 recorded in February 2020. The average AQI for the month of February was 287 in 2021 and 267 in February 2017.

340.title: Why is Ukraine a popular choice for Indians to study medicine?
340.article_body: Ukraine is a popular choice for Indian medical students who don't get a seat in government medical colleges or who can't afford private colleges in their country. Getting admission in Ukrainian colleges is comparatively easier. There is no mandate to clear any entrance as well. Annual fee of a medicine course in Ukraine is around ₹2.5 lakh to ₹4 lakh.

341.title: Ukraine compares Putin and Zelenskyy amid war, shares pic
341.article_body: The official Twitter account of Ukraine shared a picture comparing their President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and Russian President Vladimir Putin amid war. "Two leaders, two worlds...Freedom will prevail," it wrote. Comparing their locations, Ukraine shared a picture of Zelenskyy from a street in Kyiv, while writing that Putin is in some "unknown bunker".

342.title: They should not lose hope: Bangar on Rahane, Pujara getting dropped
342.article_body: Ex-Team India batting coach Sanjay Bangar has said Ajinkya Rahane and Cheteshwar Pujara should not lose hope of getting back into the Test squad. "There are question marks raised on their future...[but] they [should] go back and continue playing domestic cricket," Bangar stated. Rahane, Pujara along with Ishant Sharma and Wriddhiman Saha were dropped for Sri Lanka Tests.

343.title: IPCC warns of potential malaria outbreak in Himalayan region
343.article_body: In India, the IPCC has projected changes in the spatial distribution of malaria, warning of a potential outbreak in the Himalayan region, besides the southern and the eastern states. The IPCC released its report on Monday. As temperatures rise, the number of months suitable for transmission of Malaria will grow, the report stated.

344.title: Pic meant to inspire people, not joining military: Ex-Miss Ukraine as gun pic goes viral
344.article_body: After her picture with a gun went viral on social media amid war with Russia, Former Miss Grand Ukraine Anastasiia Lenna clarified, "I am not a military, just a woman, just normal human...All pictures in my profile to inspire people." She further said that she is holding an airsoft gun. Earlier, reports claimed that Lenna has joined fight against Russia.

345.title: Microsoft to remove RT's news apps, ban Russia state-owned media ads
345.article_body: Microsoft has said that it will remove Russian state-owned media outlet RT's mobile apps from the Windows App store and ban Russian state-sponsored media's advertisements. It will also not display any state-sponsored RT and Sputnik content and de-rank their search results on Bing. "This has become both a kinetic and digital war," Microsoft said on Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

346.title: No eyewitness doesn't mean accused not guilty: Punjab and Haryana HC
346.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court has ruled that merely the absence of an eyewitness in a case does not mean that the accused is not guilty. HC dismissed a petition challenging the conviction of a man in a double murder case. A Rohtak court had sentenced the man to life imprisonment for murdering his wife and his son.

347.title: SRK fans abused me, said 'Why did he get the girl': Deepak on 'Kabhi Haan...'
347.article_body: As 'Kabhi Haan Kabhi Naa' completed 28 years on February 25, actor Deepak Tijori said due to film's unconventional ending, Shah Rukh Khan's fans abused him. "Some...fans of Shah Rukh abused the hell out of me. They complained, 'Isko kyun mil gayi ladki'." "And of course, he (Shah Rukh) gets a bigger star in the end (Juhi Chawla)," he added.

348.title: US working with allies to seize Putin's assets: American Senator
