348.article_body: The US and allies are coordinating to not only freeze the assets of Russian President Vladimir Putin and his oligarch allies, but to seize those assets as well, said Senator Chris Murphy, who is a member of the Foreign Relations Committee, amid Russia's attack on Ukraine. "This is likely a further step than Putin's inner circle anticipated," he added.

349.title: West using Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy as pawn against Russia: Syria
349.article_body: Syrian Deputy Foreign Minister Bashar Jaafari has said that the western countries are using Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy as a pawn for their own strategic interests. "Zelenskyy is being used as a pawn of the West in strategic interests, and [the West] is now undermining his reputation by drawing him into a conflict with Russia," said Jaafari.

350.title: Earthquake of magnitude 3.4 hits Gujarat's Kutch
350.article_body: An earthquake of magnitude 3.4 on the Richter Scale was recorded in Gujarat's Kutch district on Tuesday. According to the Institute of Seismological Research (ISR), the tremor was recorded at 7:50 am with its epicentre 19 km west south-west of Rapar in Kutch. Notably, three tremors of magnitude 3.4 have been recorded in the district in last two weeks.

351.title: Spoke to you in 2011, you seemed kind, stop this madness: Ex-NASA astronaut to Putin
351.article_body: Former NASA astronaut Scott Kelly has voiced his concern over the situation in Ukraine following Russia's invasion. "Mr Putin, in 2011 I spoke with you from the ISS after my brother's wife was shot.  You seemed kind and sincere...You can stop this madness," he tweeted. "I'm afraid for the Ukrainians and for my Russian friends. Everyone will lose," he said.

352.title: CCS teams reformed in Hyderabad to track major fraud
352.article_body: The Central Crime Station (CCS) of Hyderabad Police has bought in major reforms in all its teams to control the increasing number of specialised crimes. The CCS teams will take up cases where fraud of over ₹75 lakh is reported. Under the upgraded apparatus, each police station will be attached to an additional inspector of the detective department.

353.title: Tharoor's view personal: Congress clarifies stand on Ukraine
353.article_body: Senior Congress leader Anand Sharma said that Shashi Tharoor's criticism of the government over abstaining from UNSC procedural vote calling for an emergency General Assembly session on the Ukraine situation was "personal". Strong words must not be used, Sharma added. Earlier, Tharoor said, "After our abstention, many regretted that India had placed itself on the wrong side of history."

354.title: Hope Virat Kohli celebrates his 100th Test with a ton: Gavaskar
354.article_body: Talking about the first Test between India and Sri Lanka which will mark Virat Kohli's 100th Test, Sunil Gavaskar said he hopes Kohli celebrates reaching the milestone with a century in the match. "Not many batsmen have...[scored a century in their 100th Test]. Kohli's been fabulous," added Gavaskar. Kohli last scored a century in international cricket in November 2019.

355.title: I was quietly relaxed inside: Ashwin recalls Sangakkara's retirement
355.article_body: Talking about Kumar Sangakkara, Ravichandran Ashwin admitted he was "happy" about Sangakkara's retirement, having dismissed him a "few times". "All these big batters when they get out to a certain bowler, they...come out hungrier, trying to dominate you," said Ashwin. "I was quietly relaxed inside that he will not come up front and battle against me again," added Ashwin.

356.title: Leave Kyiv urgently today: India to its nationals in Ukraine
356.article_body: In a new advisory, the Indian Embassy in Kyiv said, "All Indian nationals including students are advised to leave Kyiv urgently today. Preferably by available trains or through any other means available." Earlier today, seventh flight carrying 182 Indian nationals evacuated from Ukraine landed in Mumbai. A Russian military convoy stretching for around 64 km is nearing Kyiv.

357.title: Praying for peace in our world: Ronaldo on Russia's invasion of Ukraine
357.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo took to Instagram to criticise Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "We need to create a better world for our children. Praying for peace in our world," he wrote. Meanwhile, Manchester United have cancelled their £40million sponsorship deal with Russian airline Aeroflot. "We share the concerns of our fans around the world," said the club.

358.title: Toshiba CEO resigns amid growing opposition to restructuring plans
358.article_body: Toshiba CEO Satoshi Tsunakawa has resigned from his position amid reported growing internal opposition to its restructuring plans. Senior executive Taro Shimada, a former Siemens AG executive, who joined Toshiba in 2018, will become the new interim head of the company effective March 1. Toshiba's initial plan was to split it into three units but it was revised last month.

359.title: Turkey warns countries against passing warships through its straits
359.article_body: Turkey has warned countries against passing warships through its Bosphorus and Dardanelles straits amid Russia-Ukraine war. It invoked the 1936 Montreux Convention which lets it restrict naval transit through its straits during wartime. "We implemented what Montreux says and we will do so from now on. There has been no request for passage through straits until today," said the government.

360.title: 39-year-old man shoots his 3 daughters before killing self in US church
360.article_body: A 39-year-old man shot and killed his three daughters and a fourth person before taking his own life in a church in US' California. "The shooter was estranged from his daughters' mother, who'd a restraining order against him," police said. Investigators believe the shooting took place during a supervised visit with the children and the fourth victim was their chaperone.

361.title: When I didn't answer, they made answer of their own: Ankita on Sushant's death
361.article_body: Hinting at late actor Sushant Singh Rajput's death, actress Ankita Lokhande said she was "constantly being questioned". "When I wouldn't answer, they would make answer of their own...Vicky and I faced a lot," she said. Meanwhile, talking about her husband Vicky Jain, she said, "Not everyone has capability to stand with their woman through...difficult time. He was there throughout."

362.title: Shark Tank judge's Sugar Cosmetics in talks to raise $50 mn: Report
362.article_body: Sugar Cosmetics is in talks to raise over $50 million at a valuation of about $500 million, Moneycontrol reported. The round will be led by L Catterton Asia, an investment firm partnering with Louis Vuitton Moët Hennessy (LVMH). Sugar Cosmetics was co-founded by Kaushik Mukherjee and Vineeta Singh, who was a judge on Shark Tank India.

363.title: Undertrial arrested in harassment case dies in police custody in Thane
363.article_body: An undertrial who was arrested in a case of harassment on February 26, died in police custody in Maharashtra, officials said. The deceased, identified as Dattatreye Warke, was kept in an isolation cell at Manpada police station. Warke suffered from a seizure and fell on the ground after which he was rushed to hospital where he died, the police added.

364.title: What's allowed and what's not allowed as U'khand revises COVID-19 guidelines?
364.article_body: Amid declining cases of COVID-19, the Uttarakhand government has announced certain relaxations in the state effective from March 1. The state government has allowed swimming pools and water parks to reopen from Tuesday. All offices in the state can now operate with full capacity. However, political rallies and demonstrations remained prohibited until March 10.

365.title: Cybersecurity incidents rising due to delayed awareness among people: MoS IT
365.article_body: Minister of State for IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar said India is dealing with the increase in cybersecurity threats by revamping its policies and focusing on existing systems, such as strengthening CERT-In, to address the challenges that come its way. "Cybersecurity incidents are on the rise due to...delayed awareness among people on the issue of cybersecurity," Chandrasekhar added.

366.title: We were getting ready for transplant, I was perfect kidney donor: Vikas on sister's death
366.article_body: Celebrity chef Vikas Khanna took to Twitter following his sister Radhika's death and revealed they were getting ready for her kidney transplant. "I was the perfect kidney donor. Post surgery we both wanted to visit Varanasi," he added. "Will have to learn from today on to how to live in this world without a sister," he wrote in another tweet.

367.title: Watched 'Satte Pe Satta' at least 50 times just to see Big B's entry: Nagraj
367.article_body: National Award-winning filmmaker Nagraj Manjule, who directed 'Sairat' and has directed Amitabh Bachchan's upcoming film 'Jhund', said he has watched Amitabh's 'Satte Pe Satta' at least 50 times just to see the actor's entry sequence. "I would watch three-four film shows of his in a single day. Every second of working with Bachchan sir was precious," added Nagraj.

368.title: I challenge you to run this company better without me: Ashneer to BharatPe board
368.article_body: While resigning as BharatPe's MD, Co-founder Ashneer Grover said in a letter to the board, "Since you clearly believe you can run this company better without me – I'm leaving you with this challenge." "Build incrementally even half of the value I created so far," he wrote. He added that he'll continue as BharatPe's single largest individual shareholder.

369.title: Centre shares list of 1,786 Haryana students in Ukraine, 91 brought back
369.article_body: The Central government shared a list of 1,786 students from Haryana studying in Ukraine. Meanwhile, the state government said that so far, 91 students have been brought back. A few students have reportedly returned to India with their own efforts even before the war broke out. Haryana had received nearly 1,000 evacuation requests from state residents in Ukraine.

370.title: Ukraine Prez's wife posts pic of newborn, says 'This child was born in bomb shelter'
370.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's wife Olena Zelenska shared a picture of a newborn and wrote, "This child was born in Kyiv bomb shelter." "This was to take place in completely different conditions, under peaceful skies. It's what children should see," she added. "Despite the war, there were doctors and caring people on our streets next to her," she added.

371.title: 7th flight carrying 182 Indians evacuated from Ukraine lands in Mumbai
371.article_body: The seventh flight carrying 182 Indian nationals evacuated from Ukraine landed in Mumbai from Romania's Bucharest on Tuesday as part of 'Operation Ganga'. Union Minister Narayan Rane received the Indian nationals at the Mumbai international airport. The eighth flight carrying 216 Indian nationals has departed from Hungary's Budapest for New Delhi, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said.

372.title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella's son Zain dies aged 26
372.article_body: Microsoft has said that son of Chief Executive Officer Satya Nadella, Zain, died on Monday morning. He was 26 years old and had been born with cerebral palsy. The software maker told its executive staff to hold the family in their thoughts and prayers while giving them space to grieve privately.

373.title: Arjun shares pics from Luv Ranjan's wedding featuring Ranbir; tags Alia
373.article_body: Taking to Instagram, Arjun Kapoor shared pictures from Luv Ranjan's wedding in Agra. A few pictures were from filmmaker's Haldi ceremony where Ranbir Kapoor can be seen giving a peck on Luv's cheek. He also shared a picture of Ranbir looking at the Taj Mahal from the place they were staying at. Arjun, however, tagged Alia Bhatt in the picture.

374.title: SpaceX wins 3 more ISS crew flights, NASA deal value hits $3.49 bn
374.article_body: NASA has awarded SpaceX three additional crew flights to ISS, bringing SpaceX's total Commercial Crew Transportation Capability contract to $3.49 billion. SpaceX now holds contracts for nine such missions out of which three have been fulfilled since 2020. Prior to the update, SpaceX was contracted to fly three more missions, Crew-4 and Crew-5 in 2022 and Crew-6 in 2023.

375.title: Man issues rape threat to actress, says police can't arrest him; held in Pune
375.article_body: A 33-year-old man was arrested in Pune for issuing rape and kidnapping threats to a 20-year-old actress, police said. The accused had two girlfriends and he suspected she would inform them about the double dating, police added. The man told her police will not be able to arrest him, police stated. The girl met the man online, police further said.

376.title: No Indian will be left behind in Ukraine: Union Minister VK Singh
376.article_body: Union Minister and former Army Chief General VK Singh said that no Indian nationals stranded in Ukraine will be left behind "if he/she gets into trouble''. "If you don't have the patience and don't follow the instructions, things can go wrong," Singh added. Singh is among the four ministers who have been nominated for the evacuation mission by Centre.

377.title: Price of 19 kg commercial LPG cylinder increased by ₹105 in Delhi from today
377.article_body: The prices of 19 kg commercial LPG cylinders have been increased by ₹105 in Delhi, effective from March 1. With this increase, now 19 kg commercial cylinder will cost ₹2,012 in the national capital. The price of 5 kg commercial LPG cylinders has also been raised by ₹27. Now a 5 kg cylinder will cost ₹569 in Delhi.

378.title: Russia has fallen behind its Ukraine war timeline: US Senator
378.article_body: US Senator Chris Murphy said he was told during a classified briefing that "Russians have fallen behind their timeline" for Ukrainian invasion due to "fierce" resistance by Ukraine and "multiple Russian equipment and logistics failures". Murphy added, "Russia will try to encircle and cut off Kyiv in...next several weeks", and the fight for Ukraine's capital will be "long and bloody".

379.title: Disney, Warner Bros, Sony pausing film releases in Russia over Ukraine invasion
379.article_body: Hollywood studios Disney, Warner Bros, and Sony Pictures Entertainment said they would pause theatrical releases of upcoming films in Russia over its invasion of Ukraine. The Walt Disney said it is pausing the release of theatrical films, starting with the upcoming Pixar Animation Studios release, 'Turning Red'. WarnerMedia said it would pause this week's release of 'The Batman' in Russia.

380.title: Ashneer quit ahead of PwC report, board reserves right to take action: BharatPe
380.article_body: After BharatPe's Ashneer Grover resigned as MD and director, BharatPe said he resigned "minutes after receiving the agenda for upcoming board meeting that included submission of the PwC report regarding his conduct". "The Board reserves the right to take action based on the report's findings," the company added. Co-founder Ashneer said he was being "forced to bid adieu" to BharatPe.

381.title: Woman who dressed in men's clothes to commit thefts in Mumbai arrested
381.article_body: A 24-year-old woman, who used to dress in men's clothes to commit thefts in the western suburbs of Mumbai, has been arrested. Police said according to a driver, who lodged a complaint, the accused put a blade in her mouth and threatened to harm herself when he tried to stop her from stealing his car, along with her aides.

382.title: Gujarat Titans' ₹2-crore buy Jason Roy pulls out of IPL 2022
382.article_body: England batter Jason Roy, who was bought by Gujarat Titans for ₹2 crore in IPL mega auction, has reportedly pulled out of IPL 2022 citing bio bubble fatigue. This is the second time Roy has pulled out of the tournament after being picked in the auction. In 2020, Roy opted out of IPL after being picked by DC.

383.title: I tried to act relaxed but couldn't control emotions: Shreyas on IPL auction
383.article_body: Newly-appointed KKR captain Shreyas Iyer has revealed that he tried to act relaxed but couldn't control emotions while watching the IPL mega auction, where he was bought by the franchise for ₹12.25 crore. "My heart was pumping...I was feeling a little nervous. Eventually, KKR got me, that feeling was amazing," he stated. "I'm really proud...coming in KKR setup," he added.

384.title: PM Modi extends best wishes on Maha Shivaratri
384.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi took to Twitter to extend his best wishes to the countrymen on the occasion of Maha Shivaratri on Tuesday. "Best wishes to all of you on the auspicious occasion of Mahashivratri. May the God of gods, Mahadev bless everyone. Om Namah Shivay," PM Modi tweeted.

385.title: Sydney warned of 'one-in-a-thousand year event' of rains, floods
385.article_body: Australia's Met department has warned that Sydney could face heavy rains and flash floods over the next two days. It said that the city could receive rainfall up to six inches within six hours on Tuesday. Terming it a "one-in-a-thousand year event", New South Wales Premier Dominic Perrottet said the residents should be prepared to evacuate on short notice.

386.title: Parents accompanied me for shoots in India; felt independent in the US: Madhuri
386.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit said her parents accompanied her to film sets in India but she felt independent in the US. "I grew up in a...protected environment...But once I got married, I began making decisions by myself." "I learnt a lot...because of living in the US...When I was in India, there would...be...20 people fussing over me at all times," she said.

387.title: Nagaland allows one-time age relaxation for entry into govt service
387.article_body: Nagaland has announced one-time age relaxation for entry into government service for a period of two years starting from April 22, 2021, on Monday. "This will be one-time relaxation due to the COVID-19 pandemic and disruption in recruitment activities on account of the ban of appointments," an office memorandum from Chief Secretary of the state, J Alam, stated.

388.title: Assam Police seize 570 grams of heroin in Morigaon, 1 held
388.article_body: Assam Police on Monday seized 570 grams of heroin in Morigaon district, Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma wrote on Twitter. One accused from the neighbouring state was arrested during the operation at Jagiroad, he added. Earlier, Assam Police had recovered 1.04 kg of Heroin worth ₹7 crore in the Karbi Anglong district.

389.title: Ukraine shares screenshot of alleged last chat between Russian soldier and his mother
389.article_body: Ukrainian government shared screenshot of an alleged chat of a Russian soldier with his mother moments before he was killed. In the exchange, the soldier tells his mother he's not doing training exercises. When his mother asks if she can send a parcel, he says "I want to hang myself". He explains he's in Ukraine, where there's a "real war".

390.title: $2.4-bn fraud accused Indian founder of BitConnect has disappeared: US regulator
390.article_body: Cryptocurrency investment platform BitConnect's Founder Satish Kumbhani, charged criminally in the US for running a $2.4-billion ponzi scheme, has disappeared from India, officials said. The 36-year-old Kumbhani has "likely relocated from India to an unknown address in a foreign country", SEC attorney Richard Primoff said in a court filing. US SEC has been attempting to locate him since November.

391.title: Western Railway to run Holi special super fast trains from Mumbai
391.article_body: The Western Railway in Mumbai has decided to run Holi special super fast trains at a special fare. The trains will run between Mumbai Central- Jaipur-Borivali [Train No. 09039/09040], Bandra Terminus-Bhagat Ki Kothi- Borivali [Train No. 09035/09036] and Bandra Terminus- Bhavnagar Terminus- Bandra Terminus [Train No. 09005/09006]. Each of these trains will make two trips.

392.title: Canada comedian flies to Ukrainian border to serve as combat medic; shares video
392.article_body: Canada comedian Anthony Walker has traveled to the Polish-Ukrainian border to serve as a combat medic. Walker, who described himself as "temporary Ukrainian", shared a video on Twitter. "This war affects everyone...I would go to fight for the freedom that Ukrainians deserve, my family deserves, and you deserve," he said.

393.title: ED summons Nawab Malik's son Faraz in money laundering case
393.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned NCP leader and Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik's son Faraz Malik in connection with the Dawood Ibrahim-linked money laundering case. BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis had earlier alleged that Faraz was the signatory on a property deal involving Dawood's aide. Nawab Malik has approached Bombay HC seeking to dismiss the money laundering case against him.

394.title: If Putin wants to kill himself, he should do what Hitler did in 1945: Ukraine's UN envoy
394.article_body: During UN General Assembly's session on Ukraine crisis, Ukraine's UN Ambassador Sergiy Kyslytsya described Vladimir Putin's order to put Russian nuclear forces on alert as "madness". "If he wants to kill himself...he doesn't have to use...nuclear arsenal, he has to do what the guy in Berlin did in a bunker in 1945," Kyslytsya said referring to Adolf Hitler's suicide.

395.title: Americans don’t need to worry about nuclear war: US Prez amid Russia-Ukraine conflict
395.article_body: US President Joe Biden has said that Americans don't need to worry about a nuclear war. This comes amid ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine with the former putting nuclear deterrent forces on alert. A White House official earlier said, "We are assessing President Putin's directive and at this time, we see no reason to change our own alert levels."

396.title: Tripura High Court bans sale of meat products in public places
396.article_body: Tripura High Court banned the open sale of meat on streets or in public places in the state. It has also asked the Agartala Municipal Corporation ( AMC) to work on a long-term plan for setting up a slaughter house in Tripura. "Particular attention should be kept that hygienic conditions are being maintained within the licensed premises," court further added.

397.title: Police exhume body of Bengal student leader Anish Khan for 2nd post-mortem
397.article_body: West Bengal Police on Monday exhumed the body of student leader Anish Khan for a second post-mortem, nine days after the 28-year-old was allegedly murdered by men dressed in police uniform in Howrah. The Calcutta High Court had on February 24 ordered a second post-mortem amid concerns that the first examination of the body was carried out inaccurately.

398.title: B'luru civic body seeks police support in drive against illegal banners
398.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has sought support from the city police in the drive against illegally installed flexes and banners. "The support of police is needed to take legal action and to prevent any unwanted incident during the drive," BBMP Chief Commissioner Gaurav Gupta said on Monday. City Police Commissioner Kamal Pant has reportedly assured cooperation.

399.title: Pune reports 44 dengue, 270 suspected chikungunya cases in 2 months
399.article_body: The cases of dengue and chikungunya are on rise in Pune as the city reported 44 positive cases of dengue, 270 suspected cases and 24 confirmed cases of chikungunya from January to February 25. "Surge in cases now could be due to various reasons among people who live near water bodies," Dr Sanjeev Wavare, Assistant Health Officer at PMC said.

400.title: High levels of PM2.5 reported in several parts of Bengaluru: Study
400.article_body: High levels of air pollution were recorded in several parts of Bengaluru, a report by Center for Study of Science, Technology and Policy (CSTEP) said. The study used satellite-based products to monitor hotspots, rural-urban contrasts of PM2.5 across Delhi-NCR, Kanpur and Bengaluru in 2019. As per the study, Rajarajeshwari Nagar and South zone recorded highest levels of PM2.5 in Bengaluru.
